choices: Tidus doesn't give up,He finds new ways to contact Yuna
115221.content:
"Oh....My....."

Tidus recognized the clothing of the giantess.It was shocking to see his friend and love interest,Yuna,standing thousands of feet tall."Now....how could have Yuna gotten that big?"He asked himself,still oblivious,but not for long.Looking around,he realized he wasn't in a grassy plain anymore.The grass had grown to easily 60 stories tall.

"I've....shrunken...."

Far above,from Yuna's POV

Yuna and the rest of her friends had found each other hours ago,and now Tidus was the only one missing.She had wandered into this plain,and had decided to give her feet a rest from those sandals.The soft grass and cool soil felt good to her feet."Tidus!!Tidus!!"She cupped her hands over her mouth,hoping he would hear her shouts.

Down below,back to Tidus's POV

"Yuna!I'm down here!!"The miniscule Tidus yelled up to the Titanic Yuna,but his voice didn't even carry far enough to be heard by the most skilled of senses.Tidus was stuck smaller than an ant,and he was lost in a world that was too big for him.
115221.title: A Giant Summoner

choices: Yuna decides to rest her hot feet in a body of water
1152211.content:
He took in a deep breath.He wouldn't give up right now.There was still a chance he could survive at this size.He looked up at the vast,towering giantess who once before he was taller than by a few good inches."Yuna,I'm down here!I'm coming to you!!"He shouted,hanging his sword on his back.He hopped back a few steps,then ran forward at full speed,jumping and grabbing onto the gigantic pinky toe.He slipped for half a second,then found his footing.

Tidus was going to climb Yuna.It sounded perverted and out of a fetishist's dream,but it was the only way for him to ever survive.He reached the top of the pinky toe after 20 minutes of climbing,with much difficulty.Yuna had walked the whole time,threatening to send the tiny Tidus flying with the most twitching of movements.He looked up,Yuna still so high above.

"Better get started.I have a long way to go."He said,and began his trek across her foot.
1152211.title: Climbing the Summoner

choices: He runs into a few problems...
11522111.content:
As Yuna walked,Tidus rarely found a problem.Whenever she lifted her foot,he would duck down,and grip lightly.He found that these simple movements would keep him on her giant foot easily.In a span of 10 minutes,he had reached her ankle.Looking up,Tidus tried not to stare too long at Yuna's seductive leg,towering so high.He grabbed onto the wall that was her ankle,and began pulling himself up.

He climbed onward and upwards for a long time.His arms ached,and his sweat was blurring his vision,but he would not quit.Just when his arms felt like falling off,Tidus had reached a midway point,Yuna's knee.He climbed up onto it,as it was an easy resting point.Looking up,Tidus still had so much longer to climb.Tidus stretched his arms,and saw that they weren't all that tired anymore.

45 Minutes Later

Tidus had done so much,but he still had more to climb.He had conquered Yuna's foot and legs,and he blushed at his next waypoint.He was actually standing on a fiber of Yuna's underwear.He forced his eyes away from her private part,and continued on.He grabbed onto the smooth,tan wall that seemed miles tall as Yuna's stomach.He spat into his hands,and began climbing once more.Tidus was persistant.

20 Minutes Later

"So...close...yet so much more..."He gasped as he reached Yuna's naval,a gigantic hole that seemed to be alrge enough to contain a city in it's cavernous holds.He looked around,and whistled."Big."

He was surprised to hear an echo of his voice.He grinned like a child."Hello!"

"Hello!"The echo of his voice imitated.He could have yelled a few more times,but he had to reserve energy for the climb."Let's go!"

"Let's go!"Said the echo as Tidus grappled onto a side of the belly button to start climbing again.
11522111.title: Still Climbing

11522112.content:
Tidus carefully climbed his way up the top of Yuna's foot, which was no easy feet as she was walking, and any sudden jolt would've flung Tidus straight off. He noticed that Yuna was picking up speed, and stopped climbing in order to hold on and not be thrown off the edge. As he turned around, he saw a burning orange sphere in the distance, coloring the sky in a beautiful shade of sunset red, and he saw another orange sphere spread across the rippling surface, the ripples rushing underneath the scattered lily pads. What seemed like a captivating sight at first, it suddenly dawned on Tidus that he was dangerously close to water!

The Blitz Ace of Zanarkand was by no means a bad swimmer, however with his new-found size, the shallow shores of the Moonflow were to him a giant abyss of blue, it would be very easy for him to be swept away by the mild current and plunged into the depths far away from land. The thought that he may be lost at sea at this size frightened him, and he clenched tighter onto Yuna's foot.

With a quaking thud, Tidus looked back to Yuna, who had stopped just inches short of the shore, and sat down, her legs facing the river. As Tidus felt Yuna move her feet above ground and move them into the water, he prepared to hold his breath and hope he could hold on long enough until Yuna would bring her feet back to the surface. The water stopped short of enveloping her whole feet, reaching halfway up her toes. Tidus was spared from a dunking, and after sighing in relief, he got back onto his feet, and looked up to the summoner towering over him.

Yuna submerged her hands into the water momentarily, and began rubbing water over her legs. She had become rather tired looking for Tidus up and down the Moonflow, and had to caress her legs to soothe the strain. She continued to splash water onto her legs for a couple of minutes, before settling. The drips of water slid down her legs and past Tidus, as he watched her bathe her legs. Yuna took a moment to take a admire the scenery. Her expression suddenly changed, as she...
11522112.title: In deep trouble

choices: "Maybe Lulu would know how to resize you."
"I was hoping we could stay here a little while longer."
115221121.content:
Yuna let out a surprised gasp as she saw what at first looked like a bug on top of her foot. She was about to react in fright and swat it away, until she noticed that it looked too unusual to be a simple bug. It was standing on two legs, and was looking straight up at her. The unusual appearance piqued her curiosity, and she leaned in to eyeball it. Another shock overcame her as she recognized the figure standing there.

"...Tidus?"

Tidus was overjoyed that Yuna finally spotted him, and he jumped on the spot waving his arms and yelling "YUNA!" at the top of his lungs, though his voice was significantly quieter because of his smaller lungs that went with his shrunken body. Yuna knew it was Tidus from his reaction, though she could only hear faint muffling coming from him.

"Don't move." Yuna said to him, as she placed her hands together and started to concentrate. Tidus recognized this expression, as it was the same expression she uses to cast Esuna in her battles. As she parted her hands, a line of circles swirled around Tidus, and he could feel his body growing bigger. At last, his problems would finally be over, and he'd be back to his usual regular sized full volume self in a matter of seconds. His hope was cut short however, when the growth stopped abruptly. He had grown, but not by much. The spell had worked, but only to a short extent. Tidus was about as tall as Yuna's big toe, and repeated casting of the spell did nothing to further his growth.

"I don't know what's wrong, it's not working anymore." The summoner said with a guilty tone in her voice. "I'm sorry! I'm so sorry!"

"It's OK! At least it's better than nothing." Tidus replied. "Can you hear me now?" Tidus' voice was still rather faint, but Yuna could understand him clearly now. She gave a nod of confirmation, and started to wonder what could've gone wrong.

"I don't understand. It must be a very unusual condition if I can't cure it any more than this. I'm sorry, I wish I knew how to remedy this."

Tidus got down on one knee, and started rubbing her foot to console her. "I'm just glad you found me. I was afraid I'd have to climb all the way up to your ear!"

"It would be pretty difficult to get up my skirt." Yuna chucked. She could always count on Tidus to cheer her up, and this was no exception.

"Did you come looking for me by yourself?" Tidus asked.
"We all went looking for you, but the rest wanted to set up camp before it got dark. I insisted that I would keep looking though."
"And I'm sure glad you did, otherwise I'd still be out there."
Yuna smiled. "You know, it's funny. Wakka kept pacing up and down the highroad looking for you. If I had known you had shrunk beforehand, I'd be afraid he would've trodden on you already!"
"Yikes. That sounds painful." Joking around about the situation with Yuna helped take his mind off the perils that would come with his new size. "So, shall we head back?"

Yuna takes a moment to think to herself.
"Actually..."
115221121.title: Spotted at last!

choices: "My other foot wants the same treatment."
"I'd like you to massage my soles."
1152211212.content:
"If you don't mind, I'd like to take a moment to rest. My feet feel really sore from walking up and down the Moonflow."
Tidus felt bad for Yuna. After all, it was his fault that Yuna had to stop the pilgrimage just to look for him, when he was supposed to be guarding her!

"You know what, you can stay all you like. I was supposed to guard you, not make you worry. So I'm going to make it up to you."
Yuna smiled and tilted her head slightly. "That's so sweet of you. But how will you do that?"
"How about your feet?" Tidus replied. "If they hurt so much, I'll massage them!"
"Oh no, it's fine. I'll just splash some water on them and it'll be fi-"
Tidus interrupted. "Not another word Yuna. I insist. It is my fault they're sore in the first place."

Yuna appreciated how dedicated her newest guardian was to her. She really could trust him to stand by her, no matter how small the problem.
"Alright."
She laid out her hand for Tidus to climb onto, and then moved her feet away from the water. She positioned her sandals under her feet, sticking out enough for Tidus to stand on, then placed him in front of her left foot. Tidus gazed at how beautiful her toes were. He had never noticed them before, as she wore boots throughout most of the pilgrimage, and he spent the last ten minutes clinging onto her foot for dear life. They looked creamy, smooth and majestic. Tidus was slightly taller than her big toe, and thought he could probably fit in between the crevice of her toes.

"You can start with my toes if you like." she suggested.
Tidus was more than happy to oblige. Anything for the summoner. He began by wrapping his arms around the front of her big toe, and started massaging. He rubbed with his arms, feeling the soft silky texture against his arms, and frequently gave the toe a squeeze, embracing the smooth and comfy toe. He spent five minutes caressing her big toe, before moving onto the next one in line. It was just small enough that he could lean over the top, so he wrapped his legs around the toe, and leaned over on top of the foot to hug it, and he cheekily planted kisses on her toenail. He repeated this for the rest of the toes, embracing the soft cushion-like feeling of her toes against his body.
As he finished on the little toe and walked back towards the big toe, he wondered what it would be like to shuffle himself in between her toes and caress the crevice. Yuna spread her toes just enough so he could fit in, then closed them around him. He could feel the toes pressing against his sides, and enjoyed the feeling. He massaged the crevice with his hands, before kneeling down and rubbing his body against it and kissing it repeatedly. He could hear moans coming from Yuna. She was without a doubt enjoying every moment of it, and she could tell from the amount of energy Tidus put into the massage that he was enjoying it too. She teased him by clenching her toes tightly, trapping Tidus and squeezing him between her toes.
The initial force of her toes pushing towards each other shocked him at first, but the feeling was more enjoyable than anticipated. The force sandwiching him between her toes was cushioned by her soft skin, though the pressure was tight enough to hold him in place and smother him. Tidus could hardly move, only barely managing to turn his head towards one of her toes. The side of her toe pressed against his face, and he could feel it spread across his face. He kissed the skin compressed against him, and heard more moans out of Yuna, which caused her to clench her toes further out of delight, pressing her toes deeper into his lips. The cycle went on until Tidus stopped feeling pleasure and started to feel pain. He repeatedly pressed his heel into her big toe as a signal to relieve the pressure.

Yuna spread out her toes, and saw Tidus wander out in a daze, albeit with a large grin on his face.
"I'm sorry! I hope I didn't hurt you!" She said in worry that she could have crushed him to death.
Tidus could barely string two words together. "That... was incredible."
Yuna's initial expression of shock turned into joy, not only at her friend being OK, but that he also enjoyed it as much as she did. She smiled for a moment while she watched Tidus snap out of his daze.

Tidus looked up to Yuna, and saw that she had something to say.
"I think you've forgotten something."

1153312.title: Guy

11533121.content:
Everything was covered in the darkness of night. Stars shone brightly in the dark sky as the wildlife of Gran Pulse began to find their resting places for the evening. L’Cie were no different, the group of Lightning, Sazh, Snow, Vanille, Fang, and Hope had set up camp in the valley near the Archylte Steppe. The girl’s of the team were currently asleep, the guys were on watch. Even at night Gran Pulse was as dangerous as possible. The terrain was tough, the monsters, tougher. Especially for Hope, the youngest and most inexperienced of his fellow L’Cie. The power he held was undeniable though. His friends trusted him enough to leave him on watch.

Hope gave a yawn, bored from the inactivity during his watch. Snow and Sazh were each at separate entrances doing the same duty he was, and likely having the same boredom he was. At first the party was under constant attack by the native Pulse monsters, but each encounter only made them stronger; and now, few monsters dared cross their path. It was still best to be ready though, hence the guard duty. Hope understood all that, it didn’t do anything to reduce the boredom though. He leaned against a tree staring over the mountains, faintly spotting the form of Titan dozens of miles away. The bored thoughts turned to his newly found friends, who without them he would’ve never been where he was today.

Sazh and Snow were each respectable men. Although with Snow Hope was still a little uneasy, his mother’s death was almost directly caused by that man. To an extent the young lad still blamed the man for it, but he now knew Snow was a good guy and deeply regretted what had occurred that day. Fang was someone he admired too, remarkably beautiful and yet as much of a warrior as Lightning. Vanille he often thought about, during the course of their journey together Hope and Vanille had become essentially best friends, always keeping the other going. Last was Lightning, the beauty who taught Hope how to survive and fight. Each of these people had made Hope into the person he was now, a stronger person. He would cherish these feelings forever.

His gaze shifted to his brand. If it wasn’t for this thing I’d have never met them…The mark of L’Cie glowed as he focused on it, as it always did. It was this mark that gave Hope all of his powers, what made him more than human. There was once a time when I cursed this thing…Now I’m almost grateful for it. He released his focus on the mark on his hand, yet the glow it had did not vanish.

“Huh?” Hope removed his glove to look at his hand; its glow had grown darker than its usually green aura, the brand changing shape slightly. This usually meant one thing, “Times running out…” The boredom Hope was experiencing moments ago was replaced with a sense of melancholy. Less time to head to Oerba…and then what? No one knew what would come after their journey, or even if it would be a success. They didn’t even know if they would ever see one another again. It pained Hope to think he might be unable to see the friends he’d finally made.

Some bushes in the distance rustled, Hope stood braced himself for battle. Right on cue a small group of three of Pulse’s wolf-like creatures stepped from the bushes, fangs bared. The young man gave a look to his still-glowing hand, then looked to the wolves with a determined look. “You guys picked the wrong moment to mess with me…”

The wolves were weaklings; Hope didn’t even need to draw his weapon. He aimed his palm at the leader of the beasts, charging up a Firaga spell to end them. When he released it, it wasn’t a Fire spell that came out; it wasn’t even an attack spell. Truth be told, Hope didn’t know what it was. He just felt its power come over him along with his foes. The beasts appeared as offset as their prey. All four of them looked around expectantly; it seemed as if they all realized at the same time what was happening too. The land around them was growing! No…it was more accurate to say they were shrinking. The valley loomed further and further up as the grass quickly got big enough to cover Hope’s ankles, and then his knees.

With all of them nearing a fifth of their size, Hope about a foot tall, the beasts realized what was going on; but in their simple minds they only knew one thing for certain. Their prey was responsible for it. All three began running towards Hope with all their might. Hope pulled out his Boomerang to ready himself. The shrinking effect continued though, and in the minutes it took for the wolves to reach Hope the grass that once surrounded his feet was like a forest. The tree-like grass stood a couple hundred feet up in the sky. This was bad, on all sides were places the wolves could be, and they were good enough hunters to know it.

Hope gritted his teeth, eyes on his brand. I can’t risk another spell…it might just make things worse! But he wasn’t a very physical fighter. In the terrain Hope might actually lose if all he could resort to was his boomerang. But his friends never gave up, and neither did Hope. He readied himself to fight off the wolves when they arrived. Adrenaline pumped through the L’Cie’s veins, his senses heightened. It seemed as if every blade of grass for miles on end was rustling with the sound of movement, the wolves were impossible to detect.

Crack

The sound of a twig snapping behind him, Hope turned around just in time for a wolf to lunge at him. His boomerang held back the fangs rather well. The feral beast and L’Cie were nearly face to face, ready to fight to the death in this forest of grass. Hope raised a leg to kick it off just as the other two wolves to appear in the air. The kick sent one off by it quickly regained itself and joined its companions in attacking the young man. Hope didn’t falter, he continued trying to fight off the wolves with his weapon; but they had the advantage, and small wounds were quickly gathering all over the shrunken L’Cie. Pretty soon he was panting from exhaustion, and the wolves seemed to grin at him as they back away into the grass for another attack. Hope could follow their movements since he knew where they started at. The loud booms of normal-sized creatures moving around made it harder, but the L’Cie found the chance to attack and threw his boomerang. The forest of grass cleared away for several dozen meters from the weapon, revealing the two wolves who managed to avoid getting hit. The third died from the blow it received. Both forces stared at one another in the clearing, Hope felt his strength dwindling. The wolves were still more than strong though, and sensing the weakened prey they lunged for a direct attack. Hope braced himself for the fangs to dig into his body.

A never ending shadow engulfed everything...

BOOM

That was that, Hope stared in disbelief at what had just happened. The wolves that were so close to killing him were dead, crushed beneath the foot of something at normal size. It was a relief to see the foot belonged to someone human, even if the footwear they wore was large enough to be its own mountain. The person rose an endless number of feet into the air, probably big enough to even start thinking miles. So big they probably didn’t even realize they just crushed two monsters and saved Hope’s life. In fact, past their ankles they started becoming little more than a blur. The person was a girl, that much he was certain of (Mainly because their chest prevented him from seeing their face.) The overall figure was clear though, as was the person itself.

The one who unknowingly saved Hope was….
11533121.title: Attacked

115331211.content:
Hope let out a gasp at the sight of his immense female companion. He knew he had shrunken but to see one of his friends tower over him so was more than unsettling. Above him Fang loomed like a true giantess, seemingly even bigger than the fal’Cie Titan. Before him her left foot was an enormous mountain in itself. To give a good idea of how small he was, roughly ten feet overhead the sole of Fang’s sandal ended and then there were her toes. It was difficult to put a number on it but by his estimate Hope was about a fifth the size of Fang’s big toe, which meant roughly a fifth of an inch give or take. That was not good. Fang may have unknowingly saved him but that meant nothing if he was going to get crushed under her like a bug.

Unsure of what to do Hope did a quick jump to get atop Fang’s sandal, where the looming toes of the woman impatiently drummed. He had to be careful; those very toes could very well crush Hope without Fang ever noticing. Though the woman’s appearance begged the question. What was she doing there? It was Hope’s turn to stand watch. Overhead the woman let out a careless yawn, “Where is the little bugger?” Her head swayed side-to-side scanning for signs of Hope.

She has no idea how accurate that name is. The young man bitterly thought. Amidst the dangerous situation he took the time to stare at the brand on his hand. It no longer had any weird glow to it but Hope still didn’t feel safe using any magic. So if he wanted to get Fang’s attention he would to do it without any aid from his powers. Considering his time on Pulse this would be a lot easier. Battles against the wild had made Hope stronger than he could have ever imagined. The young man looked to the gigantic toes before him wondering how to get Fang’s attention.

Maybe just see if I can hit it or something…? Hope took a couple steps forward before the massive appendage of Fang’s big toe drummed along her sandal once again. Hope let out a brief shout before leaping back, narrowly dodging getting hit. “Okay, let’s try something else…” The young l’Cie reached for the boomerang in his back pocket. It seemed small but if he put enough force into it maybe even this could catch Fang’s attention. Hope prepared to throw his weapon when it happened.

“It looks like he left.” Fang mumbled under her breath. In a single motion she raised her foot and turned around to begin walking, totally unaware of what such a simple action caused.

To the tiny l’Cie he brought his hand back to throw his boomerang. But the moment he started to bring it forward the ground shifted, adjusting a slight angle and rising up high into the air. Hope managed to keep his footing but it threw him off just enough that his boomerang was off course. It completely missed Fang, which was horrid luck considering how big she was. Then Fang brought her foot forward in a basic stepping motion. To someone of Hope’s stature this created a strong wind pressure that pushed his further into Fang’s sandal. He finally lost his footing and slid, to his dismay, right between Fang’s big and second toes. “Ugh” Hope landed face-first in the toe cleavage and grimaced. He had to escape otherwise he could end up underneath Fang’s foot.

BOOM

The roaring sound of the titanic foot making contact with the ground was deafening. But worse than that it reminded Hope that all his troubles had only been over a single step. There was still a long way to go. Sure enough, soon the vertigo of rising rapidly through the air made the young man feel slightly queasy. Simultaneously he was moving forward at a speed fast enough to push him deeper into the crevice between Fang’s toes. Hope wanted to gag when he felt a sticky liquid begin to soak into his clothes: foot sweat.

BOOM

Hope cringed at the sound in his ears, awaiting the next step. But it didn’t come, Fang stopped. The l’Cie used the chance to free himself from his spot between the woman’s toes; though he wondered why Fang suddenly stopped. From both sides he heard the movement of her massive toes. For a brief moment Hope wondered what was going on, then it hit him, literally. Hope felt himself being surrounded on all sides. In the moment before being surrounded he saw Fang’s toes completely surround him, eventually blotting out the little light left. Hope winced as Fang’s toes grinded him between them. If he had to guess the woman probably felt an itch between her toes and stopped to remedy it. That’s all Hope was to her right now, an annoying itch.

Crack. Hope cried out as he head his shoulder bones let out a sickening crack sound. If it didn’t stop soon Fang’s toes were literally going to grind him to dust. But what could he do? The little l’Cie was unable to move, his body was being contorted and toyed with by the large toes surrounding him. His mind turned to the brand on his hand. Magic? But what if it shrunk him further? There was a small feeling of power in his palm, but Hope decided against it. He could ride this out. He knew he could, Lightning was way rougher on him than this. Almost as if they acknowledged his sudden determination, Fang’s toes eased their vice and released Hope. For a brief moment he landed back on Fang’s sandal and chuckled with clear exhaustion. “I may not be the strongest guy around but I can at least live through this.” Hope opened his eyes and instantly widened them. Directly overhead was Fang’s big toe, which wasted no time in landing on top of Hope and completely engulfing him.

Hope tried to struggle against Fang’s toe but the appendage was too big and too strong. Once again he was immobile and sandwiched between two surfaces. Though by comparison, this was much easier than the last one. In fact, as his initial fervor died down, Hope realized he wasn’t actually in all that much pain. Most of Fang’s weight was on her foot and her toes weight alone wasn’t all that bad. All it really did was secure Hope beneath her foot. Considering how easy it would be to fall off as she was walking, this was actually a good thing.

Fang slowly began to walk again and it only proved it to Hope. Little pain and he wasn’t flying around anymore. Sure there was still the foot sweat but after so many minutes the little l’Cie was beginning to adjust to it. He began to notice details about Fang’s feet he had never noticed before. For instance, despite always wearing the same sandals; not only were the sandals in perfect condition, they smelled just fine. Same with Fang’s feet, no foul foot odor. Being on her feet constantly left her sole extremely firm and well built, but still a degree of feminine softness that was oddly appealing. Hope began to appreciate all these little things, especially in the given circumstances.

Minutes began to pass and the l’Cie’s mind wandered to other realizations. What was he going to do? He couldn’t spend the rest of his life on Fang’s sandal. He had to get his friend’s attention. But how?

It was about then the pattern of footsteps stopped and Hope began to feel his position change. Gravity suddenly seemed to be pushing him towards Fang’s foot and it felt as if her sandals were now vertical. Was she laying down? A moment later her foot was on its side, with just enough space for Hope to slide from his place beneath Fang’s toe to the grassy plain below. The young man landed with a soft tap along the dirt, before him he saw the long form of Fang’s body laying against the ground. She was trying to go to sleep. Actually, not even trying. In less than a minute soft snores could be heard coming from her lips.

Similar sounds came from the left, Hope turned to see a pair of familiar boots going at least a mile into the air. He gasped at them, “Lightning!” Sure enough, beside her removed boots Lightning Farron was sleeping. Behind her was probably Vanille. This was their camp for the night. Hope praised his luck; he could get his friends attention with ease!

Though that begged the question. Which friend to try gaining their attention? Vanille was too far away so he was left between Fang and Lightning. Being right beside Fang she seemed like the natural choice, but her general rough and casual disposition made Hope iffy. Lightning on the other hand may have been rough as well, but Hope felt a bit of a natural inclination towards her. She was rough but he and Lightning got along better than most did with her.

Who to choose…
115331211.title: Riding with Fang

choices: Hope did it! Fang's eyes open
Hope stumbles and gets sucked in by Fang's breathing
1153312111.content:
Lightning may have been his preferred choice, but the fact was Fang was simply closer. At Hope’s size that meant a lot. Before him was miles of woman, and for any chance of getting her attention he would have to be at least somewhat close to her face. Magic still left him wary so Hope had only one alternative: he began to walk. Beside him the sandaled feet of his friend tilted to lay on the ground, thankfully not landing on Hope again. Not one to push his luck though, Hope put an extra bit of speed in his step before Fang’s toes somehow grabbed him again.

For the first moment since shrinking it was actually somewhat peaceful. No drama, no monsters, just Hope and his gigantic friends. To the side he saw Lightning completely still, ready to awaken at a moments notice but still asleep. Behind her there was a faint glimpse of Vanille turning over. Sazh and Snow were likely still out on guard duty like Hope was. And of course there was the giantess right next to the shrunken l’Cie. Up close each movement Fang made caused Hope to jump slightly; he had to stay prepared lest he get crushed. All it would take is Fang to roll over and he would be done for.

At the moment Fang was just sleeping on her side, facing her shrunken companion. Aside from regular snores that got increasingly loud there wasn’t much to take in. She looked like she always did but she was just…big. It was odd to look at Fang’s foot beside him and to be smaller than it. Even as he left that realm and approached her ankle Hope was still much smaller than it. Near the end of the road he saw the two cushiony mountains that were Fang’s breasts, enticing as always and big enough that Hope found himself blushing at the mere sight. Catching the mammaries got the young man thinking about just how beautiful his companions were. He always knew this of course, but now that he was smaller it seemed to almost elevate to a greater scale. Hope could appreciate the little details that went by unnoticed.

Fang radiated complete beauty, the ideal woman for sex appeal. With all the bare skin and impressive body features. Hope never tried to stare because, quite frankly she kind of scared him, but Fang was beautiful. Glancing back to her feet he saw they were shaped in what was essentially perfect, with toes not too fat or narrow and just the right length. Hope was by no means a foot guy, but it was just something small that went a long way. Much the same story with Fang’s legs: up close it was clear they were completely devoid of any leg hair and were toned to the ideal level so that they were muscular, but not overly muscular. Thus far that was all he could completely see so he looked over to Lightning.

Much like Fang Lighting also gave off the strong aura of a beautiful woman. The main difference however was Lightning was clad in less revealing attire. Sleeping on her right side though Hope found himself looking directly at her rear, which was shaped rather marvelously all things considered. Further down Hope glanced at her feet, seeing soles that were shaped perfectly. And for some reason something about Lightning’s hair color seemed to radiate in the moonlight. She seemed almost…godly, in both beauty and power. Hope shook these ideas off instantly, he respected Lightning too much to think of things like that.

That left Vanille, who Hope couldn’t actually see so moot point. But he did wonder a bit. Being one of the youngest alongside Hope Vanille had this odd relationship with him that almost seemed…romantic at times. He wasn’t sure of it himself but something about seeing a gigantic Vanille didn’t seem all that bad to Hope.

“Huh?” Hope stopped his daydreaming to look to Fang; she was moving. Just at her thighs Hope looked nervous as the woman began to turn over and lay on her opposite side. Thankfully she rolled in the direction opposite of Hope. Whew, that could’ve been bad. He sighed in relief.

His relief came too soon however. An uncomfortable grunt came from the sleeping giantess and her body instantly rolled back to how it was before, this time rolling the opposite direction: towards Hope. Hope had no time to react, overhead Fang’s thigh was incoming and he couldn’t jump away in time if he wanted to. The night sky was blotted out by a new tan sky that moved in closer and closer until…

BOOM!

…It missed? Hope had his eyes clenched shut but after several moments he opened them. To his surprise he actually did avoid Fang’s thigh. The woman rolled onto her stomach and Hope was just lucky enough to have been standing in a place between Fang’s legs. He narrowly avoided them, but it worked.

It was a bit close for comfort though; Fang was close enough that Hope felt the air warm up with her body heat. On either side of him was a high wall of tan skin that led up to her shorts and dress, both of which now in Hope’s way if he wanted to keep going. Once again Hope found himself blushing as the first thing he saw was Fang’s looming butt in his path. If he wanted to keep going, he would have to climb it.

“It’s not perverted…I have to do it.” He told himself repeatedly before continuing his walk.

After a few more minutes the l’Cie reached the base of Fang’s shorts, just at the spot where the lower end of her crotch ended and her butt began to rise into the air. Redder than ever Hope forced himself to grip the woman’s clothing and begin climbing, ignoring the idea that just underneath this clothing was the body of a woman. He wished he could just climb the dress but unfortunately it ended up on either side of Fang’s legs. Regardless, Hope continued to climb up his friend’s rear. At first it was hard but as it began to curve and grow more horizontal the climb slowly got easier. Once he got the top though Hope had to look away as he saw the two massive cheeks and their meeting point. He ran to try and get away before he kept staring.

Once he cleared climbing Fang’s rear the walk got easy again, just walking on her back. It felt odd to Hope that each step was slightly squishy against his friend’s back, but that was just something that came with the size. He’d probably have to get used to all sorts of weird terrain like this. Luckily for Hope, weird terrain or no Fang didn’t move again as he walked. Before long he was at her shoulders, looking down at Fang’s sleeping face.

The woman snored louder than ever up close, and quite frankly it scared Hope. The soft sounds came off like the roars of an immense beast. With each breath Fang made for the next snore Hope felt the suction all around him. If he wasn’t careful he’d end up with the air on that one. Is this a good idea? He looked to his other two friends; from his vantage point Hope could see Vanille. She was asleep and looked as happy as can be. Lightning still hadn’t seemed to move either. He was closest to Fang though; there was no chickening out.

Cupping his hands around his mouth Hope called out, “Fang!” Even as loud as he could shot it was nothing compared to Fang’s snores. He took a step closer to her ear, “Fang!” Still nothing, so he took yet another step and repeated. He didn’t have much choice but to do this until something happened. Finally after several attempts, Hope….

choices: bends down for a closer look
11533121111.content:
"Huh?" Fang says as her eyes fly open. Hope struggles to hold on but falls off Fangs shoulder and onto the grass below. Fang looks around and sees Lightning still asleep. "Who called my name then?" She says.

Little does she know..Hope is now by her left heel screaming for help. Hope barely dodges her giant heel as she turns for a final look around. With little choice left Hope attacks Fangs exposed heel. "OUCH!" Fang looks down and sees something by her foot. So she....
11533121111.title: A giant disaster

choices: used magic to get Fang's attention
11533121112.content:
Hope struggled to stay upright on the weird terrain by Fang’s face. As his first round of shouting ended in miserable failure, Hope decided that he would need to get to a batter vantage point before he could try again. Groaning, Hope began climbing up Fang’s hair to get closer to her ear. As he struggled up the long, black strands, the young boy realized that Fang’s snoring was blowing the hair back and forth as it swayed before her mouth. Hope gripped onto her hair tighter as he felt the sucking force of Fang’s breathing tugging on his body.

“FANG! Wake up already!” Hope shouted as he drew closer and closer to the sleeping woman’s ear. Hope’s shouts were drowned out however as Fang snored loudly, shifting in her sleep.

Hope grasped onto Fang’s hair for dear life as he began swinging in front of her open mouth. Terrified, Hope desperately began struggling up the strand of hair he was on. As the hair began cutting into his skin, Hope found he was swinging against Fang’s upper lip. A chill went down Hope’s spine as he saw the vast cavern that was Fang’s mouth before him.

“FANG! I’m serious here! Wake the hell up and help me out here!” Hope said as he tried to scurry up the hair more, but to no avail. Fang stirred in her sleep, her mouth opened wide as she yawned deeply, pulling Hope inside her awaiting maw. As Hope hit her tongue, Fang sleepily pulled her hair from her mouth, leaving Hope trapped inside.

Fang groaned as she flipped over in her sleep, laying on her back with her mouth open once again as the giant woman started snoring once more. Hope meanwhile, was busy holding on for dear life on Fang’s fangs. The young boy felt his hands beginning to slip as Fang’s saliva coated tooth as she shifted in her sleep. Slowly, Hope felt gravity getting the better of him as he looked down into Fang’s gaping throat. As Fang began snoring once again, Hope felt the rush of air pull him towards the dark cavern of Fang’s throat with each booming breath. As hope felt the strength in his arms begin to fail him, he felt more and more like this was going to be the end. Just as Hope felt his fingers give out, and his plummet begin, Fang unknowingly saved him. The giant woman’s tongue had slipped up; licking her parched lips in her sleep, and knocking Hope back up onto the top of her slippery, smooth teeth.

Hope wasn’t sure if he should be disgusted for having been covered in Fang’s saliva, or grateful for not having fallen into her throat. As he got up and felt like he was 20lbs heavier thanks to her spit, Hope felt the prior more so.

“Fang! Get me the hell out of here!” Hope shouted up through the giant woman’s open lips. As Hope continued to shout, he failed to notice that Fang had taken notice of him, but not how he had wanted. Annoyed, the giant woman snaked her tongue up to her teeth to get rid of a tiny object that was annoying her lips. She smiled to herself as she scooped up the tiny pest and spat it out of her mouth. Fang stretched out further and went back to sleep after slipping over once again onto her stomach.

“FANG! GO DIE!” Hope shouted as he was sent into the air from Fang’s graceful shot. As he hit the top of his arc, Hope looked around to see all three of the lovely ladies he had been journeying with fast asleep, all of them unaware of his plight. As Hope began falling from the sky, he looked down and noticed that there was a problem…he was headed for Fang’s foot next!

“Areo!” Hope shouted as he cast a wind spell to cushion his fall. The small burst of wind was enough to keep the fall from killing Hope, but as the blast changed his trajectory and knocked him into Fang’s sandal, Hope begins to think that dying would have been better.

As Hope slammed into the soft skin on Fang’s heel, he felt the giant woman shift in response to his presence. Hope tried to get up, but he found himself struggling to stand on Fang’s tanned heel. Grabbing his boomerang, Hope used it like a walking stick to keep himself from falling over. As Fang fidgeted in her sleep, Hope slid backwards and fell deep into her sandal, getting caught between Fang’s heel and her insole. Hope’s nose was quickly assaulted by the smell of Fang’s foot. After the past few days of fighting, Hope knew none of them were exactly clean, but Fang was an outlier by far.

As Hope felt that he was being crushed by her foot, he began beating on Fang’s foot with his boomerang. The giant woman began moving around, crushing Hope even more. As the tiny boy felt like he was going to die, he decided that he needed to act quickly. Slamming his boomerang against Fang’s heel, Hope….

He was left behind because he was the only one to believe that Serah could
be saved from the cristal, but now , and because of his action, his L'cie mark shined, and made him

the other l'cie will probably sleep soon, so he would have time to find at last one of them.

115331222.title: Sazh then?

choices: He lost a few inches off his height.
1153312221.content: The group was still in the aftermath of their battle with the primarch and their discoveries afterward. After a hectic flight they were here, in this part of Pulse, hidden right in Cocoon. The first tunnels were monster-free. They eventually chose to rest. They all sat in a circle, finally taking the time to talk as a group. Snow wasn't joining in, too depressed from information he had been given. (To help those who haven't reached the point in the story, I'm staying vague.) Lightning, Fang, Sazh, Vanille, and Hope. Their sixth was leaning against a pillar a little ways away. Vanille started in first. "Is Snow ok?" Fang replied, stating "He's a tough nut, I give you that, but I think he oughta be just fine. Give him time." Sazh felt slightly annoyed until thinking about Vanille. "I know what he's going through, a bit, though not to the degree it is for him." He looked over his pistols. "Being L'Cie is tough. Our life was torn away, and now we have to see it scab over before it can go back to normal, or as close as we can get to normal." Lightning grunted. "Even a 'Hero' has his breaking point." Hope seemed indifferent. Although their issue was resolved, it didn't mean they were pals. Hope glanced at him and then away. "I think I'll turn in. See you guys tomorrow." Hope walked a little ways and set up his sleeping bag, which was purchased at B&W Outfitters (Somehow). The group sits quietly and all soon follow. When Sazh wakes up....

121112.title: Malon?

choices: He reaches Malon...now the hard part: getting her attention
chicken thinks he's a grasshopper or something and tries eating him
1211121.content:
Link moaned, what in the name of the Tri-force goddesses happened? The last thing he remembered was stopping by Malon's farm. Link found country lifestyle like Malon had refreshing, Being from the forest, Link found city-life...bizarre. So Malon often invited him to her farm when he needed a breather. With Link running all over Hyrule as its hero, it was something he was grateful for. Time off as it were. But with Link's enemies, he wouldn't be surprised if they...

BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! BOOM!

...did something to ruin it! Link tried to ignore the booms that shook the ground. Sometimes being a hero sucked. Running around every which way, people trying to kill you all the time...it was why he valued Malon giving a place to relax. But what would piss Link off more than anything was his 'non-adventure time' being turned into a challenge for him. What made him furious was that his enemies most likely would figure that out. Link opened his eyes and found himself lying in the middle of some unknown forset. Link found that alarming. He'd been all over Hyrule and had never seen this place. Link turned when he noticed that he was standing in a shadow but the sky was still blue. He turned and Link swore like he was in a sailor convention. Standing right in front of him was Malon, BUT SHE WAS HUGE!!!!!!!!!!!!!! She turned to head into the barn to start milking the cows and Link paled, remembering she had been feeding the chickens earlier. He HAD to get Malon's attention! But with absolute dread, she was already half way across the farm...and she was WALKING! Link dashed to Malon as fast as he could go.

Eventually he had to reach her. If nothing went wrong that was...
1211121.title: Hell yeah!

choices: He slides right into Malon's boot
In a reflex Link slams his sword into Malon's leg to stop falling
12111211.content:
It seemed like an impossible task, with each small step Malon was covering a good ten yards or so and Link running full speed barely covered eight if even that. Link's mind raced as he pondered what equipment could help him; the only thing that seemed like it could possibly work was using the Ocarina of Time to summon Epona but Link was small and Epona would be too big even if she came. All the shrunken hero could do was desperately chase after his dear friend.

The chase went on for a couple of minutes, Malon casually strolling into the Horse training area and a small green dot of a hero running along the grass. But right in the midst of the field, where no horses were Malon stopped and did the one thing she did best, she sang. To Link at his size the melody was absolutely amazing, like the voice of a gigantic angel singing from heaven.

"Thank you old habits!" Link grinned as he picked up speed with renewed vigor. With Malon standing still Link caught up in no time and stood before the toe area of Malon's boots. Now came the tricky part, how would Link grasp her attention. Making a mental list Link thought of what could and wouldn't work; Deku Nuts wouldn't last long enough, Lens of Truth was useless, Megaton Hammer...well if he wanted to piss Malon off that would be a way to go. His bow could possibly work but like the Megaton Hammer it could result in just pissing off Malon and something told Link an angry giant Cowgirl was not a smart thing to face. One by one he crossed off every thing he could do, soon Link's choices for action fell down to just two small things.

One, he could play his Ocarina and hope that Malon would hear it. Or he could use the Longshot to reach the tip of Malon's boot and climb from there. Link thought for a moment and made his choice. Malon singing as loud as she was really killed the Ocarina idea so Link was left with one option, to climb his beautiful childhood friend.

He blushed slightly at the idea of climbing Malon, especially in her adult beauty but Link knew it had to be done. Sitting around would likely end in his death beneath Malon and everything else wouldn't work or make matters worse.

Carefully Link pulled out and aimed the Longshot, mentally measuring just within its reach. If it could grasp the leather of Malon's boot as it did wood and other materials Link would be successfully propelled to just below the tip, right where it starts to rise. He had to act fast so pulling the trigger Link shot the Longshot; like he thought it collided with Malon's boot but would it work? At first it seemed like it wouldn't but no Link was right all along, the moment he let his guard down Link flew through the air fast as a bullet, screaming like a child again.

Upon reaching the end of the Longshot's chain Link stood panting at his position on Malon's boot. "Man I never get used to that." After removing his tool from Malon's boot Link stared up, his friend appearing like a living mountain as she swayed side to side in song. Quickly the boys face turned bright pink as he saw a sliver of red right between Malon's legs. Embarassed Link looked away from Malon's panties, "Focus! I gotta climb."

Turning his attention to Malon's boot again Link started to climb, Malon's boots being and rough and worn as they were made it amazingly easy to climb. Every little scuff ad tear was a perfectly placed foot hold for Link. All the while he was amazed at his size, at the very least he had to be as big as Malon's thumb and well.....Malon was about fifty times bigger at least.

Due to his hero training Link reached the tip of Malon's boot in no time, but now came the hard part. Malon's boots were rough and easy to climb but her skin was silky smooth, unexpected of a farm girl and while normally attractive it made things diffilcult for climbing.

A slightly musty odor worked it's way into Link's nostrils, almost instantly he recoiled back. The scent reminded him of ancient ruins monsters had effectively turned into a foul hellhole but the source of the smell this time? The inner part of Malon's boot.

"Glad I'm not in there" Link chuckled as he figured it out. Reaching an arm up Link grabbed Malon's lower calf and rushed up a good ten feet. He only got that far because he rushed though, once he had to grab again the skin was too soft to support his entire body weight and he began to slide down....
12111211.title: How to Get Malon?

choices: "I recognize that much green anywhere...Fairy Boy?!"
121112112.content:
Despite being a farm girl Malon’s perfectly toned legs were simply too soft to support poor Link’s body weight, his grip didn’t even last a second before he began to fall. With his back to the incoming ground Link got a good look all the way up Malon’s dress, her muscular yet feminine legs…those luscious thighs…the dark red underwear she wore…the sight was making Link happy in a way he didn’t understand; maybe if he aged properly he would’ve known but skipping seven years in time left him rather clueless. The lack of teenage perversion did have an advantage though, Link managed to keep his head clear and focus on the matter at hand, his death if he didn’t save himself.

He already got a faint whiff of the inside of Malon’s boots, he did not want to experience that at Ground Zero, nor get acquainted with the ground or Malon’s boot treads. No matter where he could land Link would end up dying, be it the impact of falling, crushed inside Malon’s boot, or simply getting crushed by the boot. Something had to be done in order to save himself.

In a single split second Link ran through all his tools in his mind, seeing which would work. Most of them weren’t even relevant to the situation; in fact, the only one that could possibly be of help would be the Longshot, but Malon’s legs weren’t like leather, it wouldn’t likely latch on. That ruled out every single tool he considered, but Link’s subconscious knew what to do. Link’s hand found its way to the Master Sword, quickly unsheathing it; and like many times before, in order to save his life from plunging to his doom, Link stabbed the sword into the nearest surface possible, Malon’s upper ankle. He didn’t want to use it given it could hurt Malon, but Link’s instincts basically forced him to do it. It worked wonderfully, Link slid a few feet to a stop, no longer falling. There was but one thing Link regretted about this…the several feet of leg cut open by the Master Sword, blood started pouring out in gallons; although to Malon the cut was maybe an inch, the blood hardly any. Some of Malon’s blood dripped down to Link, but he didn’t even notice it in comparison to what happened moments earlier.

“YEOW!!!”

The second Link stabbed Malon the giant cowgirl let out a deafening roar of pain, it couldn’t have hurt that much, but the surprise was what caused the scream; Link instantly felt bad. But there was a silver lining, “What was that?!” Malon verbally questioned as she began to lean over to examine her wound. Surely she would see Link beside her cut and all would be well, he might have to pay for cutting Malon later but at least he’d be found!...Right?

Not even close, Malon sat down and, with her ankle on its side, investigated her cut. Her self diagnosis didn’t do much to make Link happy, “Ow…I must’ve stepped by a sharp twig…or maybe even a small shard of glass…I better find it to make sure the horses don’t get hurt…” Link stared sadly at his sword, the legendary Master Sword, a small twig? Not a proud moment, especially given Malon didn’t notice him.

“Hmm?” Link’s hopes raised back up when he saw it, Malon was looking right at him! “What’s that…?”

Link, waving with one arm while the other held his blade, yelled for Malon’s attention, “Malon!! Don’t here! It’s me…Link! Fairy Boy!”

Malon’s hand began to come towards Link, she heard him! Now she’d pick him up and all would be well in Hyrule again…wait…that hand was coming awfully fast…and it was open…

SMACK!

Malon smacked her ankle with a bit of force, “Ugh, damn mosquitoes; drink my blood? Not on my watch, if you guys are around then the Cucco’s get hurt too!” It was sweet that Malon was looking out for Lon Lon’s Cucco’s…but what about Link? Malon brought her open palm up to her face to check.

Right in one of the wrinkle’s of her hand was a slightly red, very light headed, Link. He had an almost comical expression, “Hey Malon…I see Cucco’s…I didn’t know they could fly…” He was literally seeing birds, but Link managed to recover a moment later. “Ugh…Malon…! I’m right here! It’s me Link, don’t hurt me!” He would’ve waved his arms or something, but Malon’s strong smack had left his puny form embedded into the wrinkle’s of her palm, Link couldn’t even move. And to fit into a wrinkle of the farm girl’s hand…Link’s pride took another blow.

Malon meanwhile, stared intently at her hand. The mosquito looked rather odd…some sort of a mixture of red and green; Malon never saw anything like it, and for some reason she seemed to have a desire to examine it further…the red could be her blood but that would mean the mosquito was green…what kind of mosquito is green? Not any Malon knew of.

Link continued his pleas for help too, but his small, squeaky voice didn’t even register point blank. He soon realized it was futile and took to struggling for the use of his limbs. Some red liquid got into his face, maybe his or Malon’s blood…he sort of hoped his because he didn’t want to accidentally ingest any of Malon’s blood, that would be a little weird…and maybe taste funny. But it did end up making Link wonder how bad he looked. If Malon saw bright green she’d have a better chance of recognizing the Hero, but if it was mixed in with a lot of red then there would be no way of telling. Link’s first plan of action would be to free a hand and wipe the blood off, not just for his own comfort but it could help boost his odds of getting recognized.

Not even a moment after the planned was formed did Malon say, “…Wait a second…” Link stopped his struggles.
121112112.title: Smacked Down

choices: Malon's ticklish...she feels something down by her foot
Malon walks to her bedroom and goes to sleep
1211121122.content:
His hopes quickly diminished down to match his size. Her words thundered through the air, sealing his fate. With a face slight disgust, Malon brought her hand to her shirt, about to rub the remains of the mosquito onto her work clothes. Another stain wouldn't be a bother. A solid wall of living fabric came up and sandwhiched Link between itself and Malon's hand. As the tiny green hero struggled to breath, his arms feebly trying to wedge himself free, he realized Malon had mushed him up against her chest. "GA-AA-AH!!"Link screamed at the embarressment of it all. After a few more seconds, the giant farm girl had stopped rubbing Link into her shirt, satisfied that the 'bug' was finally deceased. Of course, our tiny green hero wasn't, he was simpy paralyzed and embedded deep in the fabric of the clothing.

Link blanked out into a welcome darkness, allowing himself to rest from the trials before."A nap would be nice..."He muttered under his breath. Beyond the veil of sleep, all he heard was rumbling and a lovely singing voice.

The next time Link awoke, he was in a sea of fabric. Freeing himself from the fibers, he rose to his feet, looking about at his surroundings curiously. The forms of the landscape looked familiar. He was still in Malon's shirt, offin the distance some mountains that looked like boots, undergarments next to those...it appeared to be night, and he was in a pile of clothing that needed a good washing regarding the smell.

He began to leave behind the pile, the tiny green dot guessing he had wound up inside Malon's home. The wooden floor acted as a terrain, the only path given for him to follow. An all too familiar rumbling was heard after an hour of walking, and out of nowhere a masive bare foot slammed down in front of him. High above, the still huge Malon, clad in her sleep wear, yawned and took a sip from a glass of water. Futile to the end, Link jumped up and down, cupping his hands around his mouth and shouting. He was still not heard, and the giantess was about to leave up. Before she raised her foot, Link latched on, gripping with all of his strength to the smooth skin, trying to hold on for life.

1211122.content: I don't know about the rest of you, but I love me some sushi. How about Ruto?
1211122.title: Ruto

choices: Link shrinks to nearly microscopic size
12111221.content:
Princess Ruto was most displeased. She was royalty, had a kingdom, and would one day rule over all the Zora, but she was also a woman that had waited a very long time for her husband. Link was her husband by her people’s traditions and he should be there with her, doing what all Zora husbands were supposed to do. But he wasn’t and Ruto was getting angry. She had accepted that he had to go on that silly quest to stop Ganondorf, but he had accomplished that years ago. Hyrule was safe, princess Zelda was safe, so why hadn’t he come back to be her husband.

Sitting in her room, Ruto looked at it with sad eyes. She’d had a special room built that wasn’t underwater and was especially private just for her to live with her husband. She had decorated it too with blue and green colours, their favourites. There wasn’t much for Ruto to do with her father running the kingdom. She had no responsibilities, no ambitions, nothing other then the desire to see her husband again. It was in that moment of loneliness she decided that she had waited long enough. It was time for Link to fulfill his role as her husband, whether he was ready or not.

Ruto started writing a letter to send to her husband that would lure him back. Ruto may have been a fish, but that didn’t mean she didn’t know how to reel prey in.



Walking quickly towards an above water citadel in the Zora kingdom, the Hero of Time Link’s face remained impassive as he went to meet the Zora princess. He had gotten a letter this morning, warning him of a potential threat to Hyrule that only he could stop. The letter had been vague, but it said to speak to princess Ruto about the danger and to tell no one. Always the hero, Link went right away bringing his shield and sword just incase. He was a simple young man, believing in justice and protecting the innocent. He gave no second thought to coming to see princess Ruto, an old friend from childhood. He just hoped she didn’t bring up that whole marriage thing.

Link noticed that there was no water in Ruto’s home, which was odd for the aquatic race. Pulling out the letter, he read that she wanted to meet him in the top room to discuss something of the greatest importance. Always vigil for danger, he entered Ruto’s room and for the first time in years saw his old friend sitting on her bed. She looked unchanged, same smooth blue skin, same cute face, and same sleek body. From what Link understood, she was quiet a beauty in the eyes of Zora males and sought after by many of them. He also knew from rumours that she refused them all, claiming she already had a husband and some day he would return to her. Link knew she meant him, much to his discontent.

“It is good to see you Hero of Time. We have much to discus, sit beside me,” Ruto said formally and gestured to the empty spot beside her. Link did as he was told silently, secretly grateful that Ruto was all business and not mentioning the marriage. Maybe he could get out of here without her asking him when he was going to settle down with her. Once he was seated next to her, he noticed she had a bowl cradled in her hands that blue liquid sloshed around in. He gave no second thought to the strange liquid, focusing on whatever danger was at hand and what Ruto had to tell him. He stared at her in her center eyes, unflinching as he waited for her to explain.

“Before I tell you the danger, you must drink this special potion. It is crucial to your destiny.” Ruto held out the bowl and Link took it without a second thought. She had said destiny and Link knew never to question that. He lifted the bowl up and took a gulp. The liquid tasted foul, but he had tasted far worse on his travels. The liquid went down smoothly and he drank every drop. Handing it back to Ruto, the princess remained serious a second more before grinning merrily. She explained with a giggle, “The great danger is me spending another day without my husband.”

Link grumbled, saying nothing else as usual, as it sank in that he had been tricked into coming. Never one to talk things over, Link started to rise, but tumbled to the ground. His body had suddenly gone numb all over. Lying on his back, he stared up at the ceiling and cursed inside his head for drinking that potion without asking any questions. Ruto stared at her husband lying on the floor and slowly rose to her feet. Walking around him, she admired her paralyzed hero and gleefully anticipated what was going to happen next to him. “You might be cute and brave, but you can sure be dumb too husband.” She told him lightly, kneeling down at his side to take away his weapons.

Link watched helplessly as he was disarmed. It was humiliating for the great hero to be defeated so easily and he would have some strong words with Ruto once he got control of his body back. She tossed his sword and shield away like they were worthless, she was much more interested in her real prize. Link stared back at her angrily, but it bothered her none. Soon, petty things like anger and independence would be unimportant to the Hero of Time. He would belong to her forever and there was nothing he could do. She could see it had started.

Ruto’s face seemed to be getting further and further away from Link by the second, which made no sense because they weren’t moving. Feeling his clothes getting larger and his feet start to come out of his boots, he realized what was happening. Somehow he was shrinking. Ruto got further away, her body growing larger as her face disappeared seemingly hundreds of feet above Link. His clothes draped over him like a blanket, as he became only a few feet tall. Ruto kept smiling warmly, reaching down for Link’s cap as it became too big to fit him.

“Poor hero, I wouldn’t have to do this if you had just acted like a Zora and not run off. Now you’re going to be my pet husband. It’s so sad,” Ruto said, not sound upset at all about what she was doing to him. Link’s shirt became too big for him and he disappeared into it, saving him from looking at the happy face of the Zora responsible for doing this to him. He wasn’t a foot tall by now and his shirt was getting heavier. Link wondered when this would end as he became smaller then a doll.

12112.title: Where Link shall shrink?

choices: Some Hide and Seek like the good old days
121121.content:
Things were back to normal; Hyrule had returned to its peaceful prosperous self and its citizens were safe from Ganondorf's evil threat, all thanks to one young man, Link. This young man journeyed all through Hyrule and even time itself to save the land with his fairy companion Navi and he succeeded so all was well.

No one truly recalled the events of it all except for a select group of people Link himself; because through journeying through time he did save Hyrule but when he returned to his normal time period the events of his victory had yet to actually happen, if they would indeed happen. Along with Link a group of people known as Sages remembered it all; and it was their duty to be sure Ganondorf would not rise again. Each Sage was at some point a good friend of Link, except for the Sage of Light. His childhood friend Saria, his sworn brother Darunga, supposed betrothed Ruto, friends Impa and Nabooru and lastly Zelda.

Each of these people were at their homeland, living life and fulfilling their duties. Link didn't have anymore duties, with Hyrule safe he was done but there was one thing that troubled him. Navi perhaps his greatest friend had left at the end of their journey and with determination Link was preparing to search for her.

He was in front of Hyrule Castle, beside him was a reddish brown horse equipped with a saddle and before him were all of the Sages. This was a farewell meeting, there was no way to tell when or if Link would return.

The young hero stared at his trusted comrades, smiling weakly as he kicked a boot into the dirt. "I guess....this is goodbye."

All of the Sages appeared sad or at the very least unhappy, "Are you sure?" Impa asked.

Link nodded once, "Yeah, I have to find Navi. I just have to."

The goron Darunga stepped forward and stared into Link's eyes, "Are you sure brother? Is this what your heart tells you?"

Again Link nodded, "Yes, with Ganondorf gone Hyrule will be safe. Especially with you guys around. I'm not needed and I feel like I have to go journey looking for Navi.

"Be sure to bring back some treasure!" Nabooru teased, tossing Link a wink.

All Link did was smile nostalgically as he began climbing atop his horse Epona. "Link..." A girl's voice whimpered, looking up Link saw it was Saria who had tears on the edges of her eyes. For a moment it appeared as if she would run towards Link but Ruto and Zelda held her back, each shaking their respective heads.

For a moment Link hesitated, out of all the sages Saria was probably the one he was closest to but his resolve was sound and turning his horse around Link set out; behind him he could hear Saria crying and even Zelda giving a few small sniffles.

That sound haunted him for hours as he traveled, by the end of the day he had reached the edge of Hyrule. Come tommorow he would be away from his homeland but it was night and he needed to rest.

Link's dreams weren't much better than his thoughts for the day, nothing but constant images and memories of Saria, each making Link feel even worse for leaving. His night was spent reveling in this nightmare. Unbeknownst to him in Link's sleep a familar face payed him a visit, but in his nightmares he didn't sense a thing.

The next day Link did something he hadn't done in ages, he slept in; but when he finally did awaken he was shocked by what he saw. It was all familiar, the wooden furniture and floors, the humidity, even the way the air smelled; he was inside a Kokiri hut, but there was one big issue. Unless Link was heavily mistaken this room was massive! Like the kind of room a giant the size of the Deku Tree would reside in.

"I have got to be dreaming" Link muttered, conking himself on the head a couple of times to see if it would help.

Above a familiar voice giggled and said, "Sorry but you aren't the one dreaming. I am and the dream came true!" Tracing the voice Link looked directly above him, above him was the typical Kokiri bed but more importantly Saria was on the bed staring right at him!

Awestruck by the sheer size of his friend Link muttered out pointless jibberish, he had fought ghosts, ghouls but nothing had ever prepared him for this.

Giggling again the giant green haired girl spoke again, her thunderous voice echoing through Link's very being. " I'm sure you wanna know what's going on. To keep it simple I didn't want you to leave, so I did something about it."

"B-but...why like this?"

Saria smirked, even sticking her tongue out teasingly. "Cause you're so stubborn nothing else would've worked! But don't worry, now that you're like this we can be together even if only for a little while."

Nervously Link muttered something that in retrospect he probably shouldn't have. "Doing what exactly?"

The giantess lit up as if this were what she was waiting for " How about....
121121.title: Please Don't Leave

choices: The chest full of bras and panties.
1211212.content:
"...we play some Hide-and-Seek like the good ol' days," said Saria, an evil shine in her eyes.

"H-hide and seek?" stammered Link.

"Yeah. You have 5 minutes to hide somewhere. After that, I'll try to find you. If I can't find you in 2 minutes more, I'll grow you back, and you can look for Navi or whatever you do."

"What if you find me?" asked Link, shaking in his tiny boots.

"If I find you?" asked Saria, as if she hadn't put much thought into it. After a moment, a grin spread from ear to ear. "Oh, trust me. We'll have some more fun." With that, she turned around and began counting.

Link quickly searched the room. Conparing his own stature to the rest of the room, he estimated he was around an inch tall. He realized it was impossible to climb the bedpost. This narrowed his choices down to the multiple chests on the floor. The chests were quite old, so he would be able to use the knotholes to climb in. However, the inside was well-polished, so once inside, he may be unable to escape. Inside, however, were stacks of bras and panties, meaning his fall would easily be broken. Looking across the room, he saw a pair of Saria's boots on the floor. He'd be able to blend into the dark green, but it'd be even harder to escape, or even get in.

"Only two minutes left, Link. Better get looking! Hee hee!"

Startled, Link decided he only had a moment left. He'd have to choose quickly. In a split second decision, running low on time, he sprinted towards...

12312.content:
With a groan, Link opened his eyes. His head ached, and he looked around in confusion, trying to remember what just happened. He remembered sailing the Great Sea in search of the two pearls following Din's Pearl, which he had obtained on Dragon Roost Island, and encountering a strange cyclone unlike any he'd seen before. It was different than those used by Cyclos, and though it worried him, he still had decided to sail into it. And it apparently didn't end well, considering how he blacked out upon entering it.

He continued looking around and examining his current location. Clearly, the cyclone had lifted him and his boat out of the ocean and dropped him somewhere on land, but where exactly? And come to think of it, the King of Red Lions was missing too... That was a bad sign.

But an even worse sign, as Link realized with a jolt, was that he had not just been transported... He had been shrunk too.

He finally recognized his current location as the ravine right before the entrance to Dragon Roost Cavern. He sat near the entrance of the ravine, amongst a cluster of bomb flowers, with a pool of lava between himself and the cavern itself. To the other side was a large pond. The cave itself was visible in the distance, set in the wall at the end of the ravine. He stood up, recognizing that the bomb flowers were way bigger than they should have been--in fact, they dwarfed him in size! He had shrunk to only a few inches tall, at his best estimate.

Link stood still, his hand on his chin as he glanced about and took in his current situation. Apparently that cyclone had both transported him and shrunk him down, and that was certainly not a good thing. Being at this size was dangerous, and with that in mind, he was determined to return to normal. But first, he had to figure out his next course of action. Crossing the lava was impossible at his size, and the edges of the pond were too high up to grab and pull himself up if he jumped into the water. For now, he was stuck.

Link paced around, wondering what to do... And began to hear flapping wings coming from the pond. Quickly, he ducked behind a bomb flower and peeked around the edge to see what was approaching. He was surprised to see a winged individual wearing a grey/blue dress flying over the pool. He recognized this individual as Medli, the stern yet kind Rito girl whom he had met and helped during his efforts to find Din's Pearl earlier. She flew over the pool, white feathers falling off every so often behind her, and landed at the pond's edge on Link's side, her scaly yellow bird like legs and feet touching down as her wings morphed into arms. She walked forward, focusing on the cave, and Link knew that she could possibly help him out. But, hesitantly, he also thought that she might end up hurting him, considering their significant size difference. Plus, he didn't know if she would even recognize him, or be kind to him.

And so, the question was... Should he reveal himself, or stay hidden behind a bomb flower and let Medli pass for now?
12312.title: Medli

choices: "That's awful! Don't worry, I'll help you get back to normal!"
"You know, I think I like you better like this..."
123121.content:
Link, with a deep breath, chose to step out and get the giant Rito girl's attention. She was big enough to easily crush him, but he knew she was his only hope of escaping this place. So, he waited until Medli was just passing the cluster of bomb flowers, then he stepped out from behind the bomb flower and began to yell. The half-bird half-girl stopped in her tracks, looking around in surprise.

"That... That voice," she murmured. "That sounds so familiar... Isn't that Link's voice?"

Link continued to shout, and at long last, Medli seemed to realize that the voice came from somewhere on the ground. She turned and looked towards the cluster of bomb flowers, and her big red eyes fell on the shrunken form of Link.

The young Rito looked at Link for a few moments before suddenly gasping, covering her mouth with a hand. Link simply waved at her, but did not move from his spot as the Rito girl stepped towards him, her talons clacking on the stone ground as she made her way over to him. Soon, she loomed over Link, and he stared up at this building sized girl in silent awe. She seemed so much bigger up close... and more frightening. When he interacted with her earlier, she seemed friendly enough, but considering that he was the size of a doll compared to her right now, he found it hard to not be scared of her.

After gazing down at Link for a few moments, Medli crouched, her red eyes squinting as she examined him. Link remained silent and motionless, waiting to see how the Rito would react. He got his answer when she reached down towards him with a white-feathered arm. Link realized that Medli was about to grab him, but he still did not move, knowing that he had to be brave and trust the girl, as she was his only hope of escaping this place. So, he stayed motionless, allowing the hand to reach him. The fingers curled and tightly enclosed the tiny boy in a fist before lifting him off the ground and bringing him up to the face of the Rito girl. Her big red eyes examine him closely, and after a few moments, she spoke up at last.

"Y-you really are Link!" she exclaimed, the mouth beneath her beak nose hanging open in shock. "But... How did you shrink? What happened to you?"

Link, resisting the urge to squirm in Medli's tight grasp, told her about the cyclone and how it shrunk him and sent him here. Medli listened closely before replying...

After a few seconds of this she loosened her grip a bit and Link felt something running across his head, dimly he tried to look up and realized that she was petting him with her index finger.

"You're just so adorable like this Link, I can't let you go...and besides, it's way too dangerous out there for you now, but don't worry, i'll keep you safe." Medli said bringing Link closer to her face. It completely encompassed his vision and he found himself intimidated by this giant rito all over again.
