choices: Right on the desk, with Tetra's face above
12313221.content:
By the time Tetra's hurried steps against the floorboards came to a halt, it was already too late. The three goddesses had determined your fate.

The pirate princess took her last movement forward, her toned knee shooting up into the air - along with your whole body. You could feel her sandals' worn leather rising behind your back, pushing against it. The only thing visible above was the bronze expanse of her foot's high arch. Soon, the rise of Tetra's leg reached its climax; you barely had a second to fill your lungs with salty sea air before your platform shot downwards.

It felt like the world was rapidly rising up around you. The only thing you could do was hold your green-clad arms out and scream - hoping that high above, your voice could slip into a valley of her ear.

An Earth-shaking THUD surrounded your body. The sole landed. Instantly, you felt the full weight of this behemoth pushing down on your twig-like body. How could a girl with such a fast running speed (that you just experienced firsthand) be exerting THIS much weight down? Even when she froze in front of her desk, the ship's slow rocking was disorienting. Back, and forth... Back, and forth... Your face soon turned as green as your tunic.

"Hmmm... No, that doesn't match Zuko's maps at all! Unless..."

By the echo of her voice in the cabin around, and the distant sound of a quill touching paper, it sounded like she'd just found some clue that could lead to treasure. And now, she was counter-checking them against existing notes. With her body finally still, you tried squirming out from the mighty weight above. With the sandals leaving Tetra's feet open, you'd just have to move aside, and you'd be free on the ground again. Right?

Reality crashed down on you like a smelly anvil. Throwing herself more into note-taking, she leaned forward. The ball of her foot pressed hard against your face, engulfing it in her flesh. You called out again, only to have a drop of salty water forced down your mouth. For just a split second, your tongue could feel the individual whorls and ridges forming the texture of her sole, like complex runes.

At that point, pushing back was hopeless; your gigantic captain stood firm, unmoving. The simple pull of gravity rendered you unable to move your little arms. You could only hopelessly flail your legs around, hoping she'd feel your tights.

Every attempt at breathing, with the pirate's skin smothering you, only had your nose fill with... How to describe it? Seawater wasn't adequate for cleaning clothes or bathing, and their crew went long periods with limited freshwater. The clash of odors generated from earlier quests, as a result, had little to clean it away - save the thin strand of your saliva from before. It was putrid, and yet...

You know this smell. As disgusting as the situation is, being with Tetra as long as you have means you've picked up faint whiffs of it before. As your lack of air forces you to breathe in again, you can almost pinpoint the exact moments that contributed to this musk. Like the time you two were on shore, looking for treasure - all you managed to get was a fairy in a jar. You were starting to feel sorry for that fairy now.

"Oh, when you're facing Northeast - THAT explains it." The voice above, all at once, pulled you back to your senses and makes the memories feel more vivid.

Like the walls of an ancient dungeon moving, you felt her pressure on your body release slightly. For a split second, she forced down even harder, coming horrifically close to squashing your insignificant body into her leather sandal. Then, you felt her body fly upwards, and - THUD.

Thankfully, that wasn't her titanic foot landing this time; you didn't know how much more punishment your body can take. There was a ringing in your ear, like a warning alarm. It seemed Tetra plopped her globe-like rear end on a chair. The impact sent a vibration through your body, shaking it to the core. But at the very least, The Hero of Winds no longer had to carry the weight of an massive girl on his shrunken shoulders.

You used the opportunity to call up. This left you with another mouthful of Tetra's salty skin. Spitting out, you rolled to the side slightly, shouting again.

For a second, the motion froze. Did the colossal captain hear you? Did she feel your little body wiggling below? Suddenly, you felt your worn platform shift at a sharp angle. You slid past the ball of her foot; you glanced back to see her heel lifting; finally, her toes stop you, the middle one pinching your body against a perfectly-matching indent in the leather below. It slips over your torso slowly, as if trying to identify you.

"Huh?" The young woman mumbled above. You kept your ears up and hold your breath, hoping she might have noticed you. The words thundered: "How the heck did a pebble get down there?"

A pebble. That's what you were now. Your hopes sank to the undersea ruins.

Tetra's toes began moving slowly, pushing against your body. You can feel the folds in them curling and uncurling they squeeze your body into the smelly ball of her sole. Crap - was she playing with her footwear? Her ankle gradually, almost teasingly, shifted upwards. It pulled back out of the sandal, the slender digits dragging you along for the ride. Your body rolled against the brown landscape, alternating between facefulls of smelly, moist indents, and the tanned sole that shaped them. How long had she been wearing these?

The foot pushed back in. This time, the ball just rubbed against you, without pulling forward. The sigh you hear above would be gentle and sweet, were it not so loud. You barely have any time to react before her heel crashed down, knocking the wind from your body. It's all you can taste, smell, touch, or see. And she's still moving her foot - quite literally rubbing it in your face. All your attempts at motion are losing their vigor in the warm embrace.

Embrace? Yes, that word was the first to pop in your cranium. There was something undeniably intimate about the bare skin surrounding you, giving a close-up view of each individual wrinkle and fold moving in uneven waves. Your body started heating up, and it was hard to tell how much of that is from the pirate's own body temperature. It was breathtaking - and not just in the sense that you had more and more trouble breathing every second underfoot.

You felt Tetra's idle fidgeting brush your hair back. Slowly, her leg lifted again. Your shrunken arms hurt too much to move - and both your ringing ears and intense heat are twisting your mind. But for once - and maybe for the last time - you could see the mountainous figure of your tormentor in full. The blonde swirl in her hair like unreachable clouds; the red bandana bobbing slightly as her back leaned forward; the little twinkle in her beautiful, deep eyes as they follow the motions her pillar-like arms make while jotting notes on a paper...

Again, you paused on your own thoughts. Beautiful? That didn't do it justice. When those bronze toes wiggled above you like meteors waiting to crash... When you find yourself dazzled by the sheer scale of each limb, and ease with which they move...and she can't even bother to peek down at the green "pebble"... At this moment, Tetra inspires more fear in your heart than the three goddesses, or the beast that brought Hyrule to its knees.

But still, the slight, graceful flick in her gigantic wrist as she wrote... It might be your mind slowly failing, but there was something more there. She was sliding her foot back in - no, now the tip of her large toe was just slightly touching your nose, twirling around softly. Staring into the whorl as it paws you around was almost hypnotic, especially with the short hums that let loose from her lips above. They're slender, but not lanky; the arch rests high, the curves in her sole above like hills and valleys. And without the impossible pressure it once exerted on you, they felt soft, supple. Dainty. No matter how long she's worn these sandals, no matter how effective pirates' hygiene could be, and no matter how much the seas had trained and shaped Tetra's body... This foot belonged to a princess.

Slowly, the boulder of a digit wrapped around you, compressing your body in the tight space between her toes and her foot's ball. This was where the odor was at its strongest - once again, this girl was all you could experience. Memories keep floating in your head, different faces showing up. Aryll. You feel your body lift from the ground, as your captain moves it to scratch an itch on her other foot. Grandma. The grinding motion scrapes you harshly against both surfaces, and even though you feel something tearing, you've lost the energy to scream. Tingle... Would he ever find those fairies?

The motion and pain were so intense, it felt like her simple motions were causing a second apocalypse. But somehow, the touch feels... It's like you're drifting deeper into another world with every twitch and breath, and it's not unpleasant. Somehow, you had a feeling you'd die in this pirate girl's service... You just didn't expect said service would be acting as her... massage bead... foot toy... pebble...

Familiar. That's how it felt. Seconds before falling to the welcoming void... right before your consciousness blew out like stray dust... that was your final thought: it's familiar.

...

"HYAH!?"

Your spine shot up as you began panting. The floor under your rear end was hard, sturdy. There wasn't any pressure on you. A dream? No, that was impossible - you could still see the cabin's walls stretching out miles into the distance. Your green tunic was damp, and smelt of... well, Tetra.

A fluttering sound crossed your ears. When you gazed up, a fairy waved to you before flying away. The one you caught not long ago! She must've restored you to full health, just after Tetra killed you! Without a word, she disappeared; leaving your shrunken body standing...
12313221.title: Felled by Tetra's Toes

124.title: BotW Time

13.content: Which lovely lady from DoA will a guy(or even you!) shrink before?
13.title: Dead or Alive

choices: Ayane keeps you down by her toes
She brings you closer to her face
131.content:
Waking up, you mumble in discontent at how badly you had slept. Too much rumbling and shaking, for some odd reason, had kept you in a half awake daze all night. As you rubbed the grogginess from your eyes, you opened them to find that you weren't in your room anyway. The floor was still solid, but it felt somewhat sweaty and foam-like. The air was persistantly muggy and smelled of feet. You seemed to be in a canyon, two walls, rising to an unknown height, were on either side of you. They were colored of an odd, peachy skin tone, and wrinkles which you could fit in were in vast multitudes.

"Where the hell am I?"Who ask yourself, puzzled. The night before, all you had done was play a few Dead or Alive games on the consoles you owned. Besides that and chowing down on some snacks, nothing. A blank came to mind as what happened in your sleep. An earthquake out of nowhere rocked you from your sitting position to flying through the air, landing on your back with a heavy thud. The entire world seemed to be moving in sequence with the earthquake. Up and down, as if walking. You stumble back up to your feet, steadying yourself in the rocking and swaying landscape. You approach one of the canyon walls, gripping onto it for dear life. Surprised you were when it felt just like skin, soft and smooth. You rubbed your hands up and down it, perplexed. The earthquakes stopped, but a deafening, roaring noise came afterwards. Oblivious to this connection, you continued to somewhat massage the wall. The noise began to sound like laughter, but magnified to god like proportions."Stop it! That tickles!!"A female voice thundered along with the giggling.

"Who's there?!"You immedietly stop rubbing, looking around for the source of the voice."Me, Ayane."The female voice replies.

"Ayane....Ayane...."You've heard that name before. A character from the Dead or Alive videogame. She was your favorite female character."Where are you? I can't see you!!"You shout, still vainly searching.

"Maybe that's because I'm too big for you to see me! You are just a tiny speck between my toes,"The unknown voice of Ayane said.

"Wha-"You look up, the reality of the situation finally settling in. Ayane, in her shinobi outfit, towered above you, her legs monolithic pillars that made skyscrapers seem run-of-the-mill. Her face could scarcely be seen past her titanic breasts, which were considered one of the biggest pair in the series.

"I found you on my travels...by accident."Ayane explains."I stumbled down a hill, and found you, all defenseless and tiny, curdled up in a sleeping position."

"I couldn't just leave you there to be squashed or eaten, so I put you safely on my sandal."

You blushed at the kindness."Thank you..."
131.title: Ayane, The Blue-Haired Shinobi

14.content: So now the BIG question: Who is it that turns small?
14.title: Sonic the Hedgehog

choices: He's....on the ARK?! In Maria's room?!
He's still where he was before....shrunken.
142.content:
It was dark, a room with little to no lighting in it; in the center sat a spiky figure huffing. His eyes were filled with pain, his eyes red as the streaks that designed along his black body. Around him were bodies, bodies of other beings like him, his friends; Rouge, Omega, Knuckles, Amy, and even Sonic. They all bore deep wounds, impalements really. Only Shadow was unharmed, but his friends were all dead.

"I...couldn't save anyone...again." He muttered with a tear sliding down his cheek.

--------------

"WAKE UP!"

Shadow opened his eyes to a gloved hand smacking him on the forehead, eyes filled with surprise. The gloved hand retracted after its blow, going back to the side of who had it, Rouge the Bat. Typical of her Rouge was in her outfit which seemed to be a black jumpsuit with a heart design for her nice cleavage, and a pair of white boots and gloves to match. One would never guess that she's a world class thief.

"What happened?" The hedgehog muttered, his head throbbing slightly from Rouge's smack.

The batgirl shook her head with a sigh, "You were moaning in your sleep hun. Must've been having a heck of a nightmare. Had to make sure you were okay."

Shadow's eyes narrowed, he didn't recall falling asleep, or even where he was. Looking around he seemed to be in the middle of the woods, a campfire weakly shining before him and Rouge. " Where...are we?"

Groaning loudly again Rouge smacked Shadow on the head, "Man that was some nightmare. You don't remember GUN's mission?"

"Mission?"

"ALLOW ME TO EXPLAIN" A robotic, inhuman voice rang out loudly. From behind Shadow and some trees came another of Shadow's dearest friends, Omega the robot. Omega was a bit of a pyschopath but he was none the less a strong friend and a trusting ally.

The hedgehog remained silent, gesturing for Omega to continue. The robot took another step forward, his electronic eyes seemed focused on the camp fire. " GUN ASSIGNED ROUGE,SHADOW, AND MYSELF TO INVESTIGATE A MYSTERIOUS ANOMALY IN THE DESIGNATED AREA. BELIEVED TO BE CONNECTED TO DR. EGGMAN."

Leaping up next to Omega Rouge conked him on the head, "You idiot! Keep it down! Turn down the volume or something!"

"NEGATIVE, AND YOUR NOISE OUTPUT LEVELS ARE HIGHER THAN MY OWN."

Gritting her teeth Rouge appeared as if she was about to leap at Omega but Shadow brought forth a gloved hand and held her back. "Tell me Omega. Do we have any information regarding this anomaly?"

The machine was silent for a moment, " ALL THAT IS KNOWN IS THAT IT INVOLVES HIGH LEVELS OF ENERGY. ALSO A RECENT STREAM OF DISAPPEARANCES ARE BELIEVED TO BE LINKED. "

"Anything else?"

"NEGATIVE"

Shadow sighed, " So we're studying a mystery basically?"

Playfully smiling Rouge winked at Shadow " Yeah but no worries. We're bound to find some nice jewels! Or if we find the missing people we get rewards!"

Both of the others seemed to roll their eyes.

"Don't care."

"ERROR"

Rouge fumed, "Not nice!"

Together the trio laughed, even Omega although his seemed more...forced; robots weren't exactly programmed to laugh. With this enjoyable time they relaxed, for it was getting late and tommorow things were going to probably be rough.

It wasn't long before everyone was resting, Omega turning on "Sleep mode", Rouge sleeping in an extravagant and overall uneeded tent, and Shadow leaning against a tree lost in his own nightmares again.

The dreams were hazy, nothing like they were before; it was nothing but a blurr that Shadow barely acknowledged. What his focus was on was that despite being asleep, something seemed horribly amiss. Shadow shrugged it off though, or at least in his sleep filled state he did.

Hours passed but through sleep it felt like moments, Shadow opened his eyes weakly, quickly widening them to their fullest. The area all around him...it was unreal...gigantic, the world around him was over a thousand times bigger than before! Somehow, someway he must've shrunken!

It was amazing, Shadow was at....
142.title: Team Dark's Investigation

choices: He forget about it and stays where he is
1421.content:
Shadow recognized his surroundings after a few seconds of staring at the giant surroundings. He’d been here several times before, when he wasn’t tiny. Pink wallpaper, with pink curtains and pink carpet decorated the room. Pictures of a smiling blue hedgehog were hanging all around. Some with had him all alone and several were with him standing with a pink hedgehog. This was the home of Amy Rose, Sonic’s girlfriend and usual damsel in distress.

Amy had invited him in several times, but he never stayed long. He found that when he was in her home he always felt very uncomfortable. Amy had a warm and inviting home, which made Shadow uncomfortable. He was used the dirty depressing places that matched his mood, not the happy little home of Ms. Rose. However, right now he’d love to be feeling that uncomfortable sensation. Amy’s giant house was giving him the creeps as he didn’t know how he got there or why he was so small.

“Maybe this is a dream,” he mumbled to himself as he walked around. The carpet fibers reached over his head, making it only possible for him to stare far above him. He could see towering tables and walls that seemed to go up for thousands of miles. He had no idea how small he was, but he’d guess he was about as tall as an ant. It was so insane to wake up the size of an ant that Shadow was convinced that he had to be dreaming. He reached over to pinch his furry arm, when a sudden earthquake followed by a loud boom drew his attention.

Looking around desperately for where the sound was coming from, he saw something huge moving miles away from him. The earthquakes became stronger and the booming louder. Shadow backed away, terrified about what could possible be huge enough to make such a noise. Imaging some giant monster, Shadow nearly collapsed as Amy Rose, seemingly hundreds of miles high enter the room. He had been wrong. He wasn’t the size of an ant, he was much, much smaller.

The city sized girl walked slowly into the room, but to Shadow it seemed like she was traveling miles every time she took a step. She was walking right towards him, he could see the bottom of her red sneakers lifting up and stomping back down on the rug. Running as fast as hover skates would let him, Shadow tried to find safety, but he couldn’t take his eyes off Amy. The cute pink hedgehog looked absolutely terrifying at her size, like a whole mountain walking towards him. Shadow knew this couldn’t be a nightmare. His guilt-induced dreams could never come up with the thought of this titanic girl looming over him. He was running as fast as he could, a speed that would normally match mach-5 speeds. But the carpet was slowing him down and even if he was running on a flat surface, he was only going a foot a minute, not a speed that could match the leisurely walking girl behind him.

Turning his head back to what was in front of him and not the approaching mega-giantess behind him, Shadow saw his salivation. There was a couch only a few miles away from him. Anyone normal would never make it, but Shadow was far from normal. Depressed, but not suicidal, Shadow ran as fast as his furry legs would go. Every second mattered as Amy got so close that Shadow was running under the shade of her short red dress. Looking behind his back, he saw her giant feet lifting up again and coming down where he had been standing a second ago. The carpet was flattened under the treads of her sneakers and Shadow knew he’d be finished if he was under those massive feet. Sweat running down his face, he leapt forward, arms outstretched for space under the couch. He disappeared into the safety under the couch just as Amy’s foot came down. Lying in the darkness, he lay only a few feet from the giant shoe. He watched it lift up again, bits of dirty and dust dropping from the bottom as Amy moved. That had been close.

Relaxing, he watched as Amy continued moving. All he could see were her feet as they stomped down onto the ground. Above him, he heard a screech of steel coils as Amy sat down on the couch. He heard her voice, booming loud, yet still sounding sweet. “What a day I’ve had. I slept in, missed breakfast and Sonic hasn’t called me yet.”

“You think your day was bad? What about mine?” Shadow grumbled, wondering what he had done to deserve this fate. Oh, that’s right. He failed to save Maria.

Before he could go into another fit of remorse, Shadow focused himself in the dangerous situation he was in. He had someone been shrunken and ended up in Amy Rose’s house of all places. Staying under her couch wasn’t going to help him, he’d end up getting crushed under a dust bunny or eaten by a bug the size of small house. Walking over to the edge of the couch, he stared at the tall red wall of rubber that was Amy’s shoe. She was the only one that could help him, but how could she get her attention.

Shadow wasn’t just fast and strong, he also had a genius intellect. He wasn’t called the Ultimate Life Form because he could outrun a cheetah. But even his mind could come up with no way to contact the oblivious giantess without putting him in immediate danger. He needed to get closer to her face and the best way to do that was to travel up either her feet or the couch. It would be easier to get onto her shoe and wait for a chance to get her attention, but it was safer if not slower to climb up the couch. Knowing that he had to do something, Shadow decided, only hoping that luck was on his side for once.
1421.title: Speed matters when you're small

choices: Still stared at the sky in boredom.
Kicked her legs out of boredom, unknowingly sending Shadow into her boot
14211.content:
Beneath Amy's mountainous couch Shadow made his choice. It wasn't a particularly hard choice to make really, Shadow needed to be found ASAP and Amy would likely move after a while so he had to hustle. So using the fast route and climbing up Amy starting from her boot was easily the best thing to do. There was an increased risk but nothing in this life came free, at least that was what Shadow told himself.

Not wasting even a milisecond of time Shadow vanished in a puff of smoke, his slender black and red frame little more than a blur to nearby bugs and anything around his height. The giant pink hedgehog didn't see a thing, her head was tilted back as she seemed to focus on the clear blue sky; no doubt thinking of Sonic. After about thirty seconds Shadow found himself right before the tip of Amy's boot, its gigantic size unbelievable.

Shadow was literally the size of a speck of dirt compared to the vast rubber tower, heck even the rubber treads of it rose over a dozen times his height! Every little bone in Shadow's body seemed to reconsider, his base survival instincts roaring at him to turn around and run, but Shadow effortlessly fought the feeling and placed a gloved hand on Amy's boot. It's surface was smooth like glass with no holes or notches to grab onto, climbing it was going to be no easy feat but then again nothing Shadow ever did was easy. At least... it wouldn't have been easy for someone like Sonic who actually ran but Shadow had a slight advantage in this situation.

Raising a foot the black hedgehog placed her sneaker on the massive boot, activating its jets. His leg no longer felt like it was raised, instead it felt like he was standing on solid ground on both feet. Smirking slightly Shadow placed his other foot on the boot, while he first one was still midair! Like the first the other foot's jets roared to life, now Shadow was literally standing sideways!

"I really like these Skates" Shadow chuckled to himself, his body bending over like he was about to sprint. Focused solely on running Shadow took off with a sonic boom, his black body again naught but a blurr as his speck sized self ran along Amy's boot. The black hedgehog was amazingly fast but his size heavily hindered the distance he traveled. At the speed Shadow traveled he would probably cover six to nine inches per minute which while amazing for his size still provided a huge danger in itself. Amy was about four to five feet tall, meaning Shadow would take about seven minutes at least to reach her ear; a lot could happen in seven minutes. All Amy would have to do is a slight act, kick her feet, get up, even sneeze and Shadow could easily die or worse.

Shadow knew all of this before he even started, to any other person it would have likely made them reconsider but for Shadow it only fueled his determination. Like a bolt of black lightning he thundered his way across Amy's massive foot. It had only been a few seconds and already he cleared the rubber treads that easily dwarfed him, now he was running along the red which while progress also meant now he stood out on Amy's boot, should she see him Amy would likely treat him like a bug.

His face held the same apathetic expression it usually had but on the inside Shadow was in complete awe. He, one of the strongest and probably most feared beings on the planet was naught but a speck of dirt on Amy's boot. In a fight with an ant, he might actually lose. It was tough to absorb this newfound weakness, but Amy seemed to make coping easier. She was a cute girl to be sure but Shadow always found her kind of annoying, deep down he truly respected Amy though; for her likeness to Maria if anything. But at this size....that cute appearance had manifested as total beauty and a god-like sensation. Everything about the giantess was magnified, her pure eyes, pretty features, even her....assets. To an extent Shadow enjoyed the sight, not that he would ever show such.

"Man...WHERE IS SONIC?!" Amy shouted, her voice actually bringing a level of pain to Shadow. For a moment Shadow was nervous, Amy almost seemed to prepare to move which luckily she didn't.

"I've gotta hurry." Shadow thought aloud, trying to go even faster. It had now been a couple of minutes and Shadow was nearing the opening of Amy's boot and the beginning of his run up her leg. Amy....
14211.title: Speed is Quite in Handy for Climbing!

choices: Someone shows up....but it's not Sonia
142111.content:
Amy yawned, continuing to stare at the sky in boredom. "What to do?" then she pirked up. "I know! I'll invite Sonia over!"

Shadow froze. PLEASE let him have heard that wrong! Not the Faker's sister!

Shadow felt like ripping his quills out, if Sonia found him like this...the ultimate lifeform shuttered. It wasn't that he minded Sonia...she was actually pleasant company, but it was like there were two Amys with how much she liked him. It didn't help that she had a second brother, a street-wise green hedgehog named Manic. He was just as annoying as Sonic AND twice as loud if it came to the idea of Sonia dating. Seeing as he considered Shadow "The God of Brooding who wouldn't stop ranting about being the ultimate lifeform and Maria" he was especially irritating about her social life in the regard to who'd she'd like to date...thing was, Shadow and Sonia hadn't even dated one time!

Amy hopped to her feet, causing Shadow to slid down her leg and he grabbed the opening of herr boot. He struggled to hang on as Amy walked over to the phone and called Sonia.

"Hey Sonia, its Amy (pause) Yes, its good to hear from you too (pause) Well the thing is, I was wondering if you could come over, we haven't been able to hang out in a while (pause) You can? Great! When can you get here? (pause) tow to three hours? Perfect! See you then! (pause) Ok, see you soon Sonia!"

Amy hung up the phone and grinned.

Shadow suddenly wished he'd have let himself get blown up by Devil Doom when he'd stopped the Black Arms.
142111.title: Still stared at the sky in boredom.

choices: Amy felt something on her toe
Amy decided to go on a Sonic Hunt ASAP!
142112.content:
It was almost too easy, with his ungodly level of speed Shadow was making great progress on the Giantess Amy's boot. Already he was nearing the tip and at best it had been two minutes since his take off, and thankfully Amy still hadn't done a thing other than occasionally moan about Sonic. Inches away from the boot's opening Shadow couldn't help but sneer, "Too easy." With a quick acrobatic leap Shadow had leapt away from the Amy's skyscraper sized feet and landed on the pink fur of her thin leg. For an instant Shadow had a sudden worry, would the jets on his shoes cause some sort of ignition? Shadow climbed a lot of things, furry giantess friend was not one of them; this was a whole new experience and there was no telling what could happen.

The moments hesitation almost caused the hedgehog to fall, but in the last instant Shadow damned the risk and forced his body to land. It was a bitter sweet moment when he landed. Sweet because he hadn't harmed Amy in the least and could safely proceed. Bitter because it crossed Shadow's mind that he was probably too small to actually ignite; not the proudest moment of his life. But this was not the time for pride, later when he's normal he would dwell on the fact that even for a small amount of time Amy was basically a god to him. His fate was in her hands....or currently legs given the situation. Oh boy did Shadow think that too soon.

A yawn escaped Amy as her whole body stretched, "So BORED! I can't believe Sonic stood me up again!" She had specifically told Sonic to come at three P.M sharp! What was taking him so long?!

Amy's legs stretching was a...unique challenge if ever there was on. The sudden movement of hundreds of muscle layers made the entire footing of Amy's leg unstabe and even with his skates Shadow had a rough time keeping his balance. It was only a mixture of pure skill and luck that Shadow didn't plummet to God knows where. He took a look over his shoulder to see what could have been...the possibilites were unfortunate. The floor, sent across the room, collision back against the boot, falling IN the boot was the worst and sadly most likely to occur. But thankfully Shadow was safe, he would climb an-

"Nyeeeh!!! SONIC WHERE ARE YOU!!" Amy flailed her limbs around in frustration, "I specifically said three! When I see that hedgehog I'll hug him til it hurts!"

That was the worst possible thing Amy could have done to Shadow at that moment. If merely stretching nearly made him fall then her childish flailing definitely sent Shadow flying away. And where he went...Shadow cursed every sort of God known to man for allowing it to happen. With nothing to grab on to Shadow fell into the small opening of Amy's mountainous boot. Dammit all if he didn't try to stop it though. Ever level headed Shadow placed a gloved hand on the rim of Amy's boot, hanging on as if it were a cliff and the interior was the chasm of death; and it might have worked too, if Amy's flailing had stopped. The giantess' ankle slammed against Shadow and in a moment of dazed pain, he released his grip on the boot and fell further. It wasn't a pleasant journey either, the chasm of death Shadow imagined moments ago might have been preferable actually; at least with the chasm there weren't surfaces Shadow would collide against. In Amy's boot...there was one big surface and it both embarassed and disgusted Shadow to no end to land on it; Amy's bare foot. The first landing sent Shadow face first into the top of Amy's foot, and with a gasp of pain Shadow literally had a chunk of foot in his mouth, naturally he spat it out in a milisecond. This would have normally been the end of the journey but oh no, Amy was still flailing around and whining, so Shadow was airborne once more. He felt like he could actually fly too, from the sheer power of Amy's foot jerking around; but that only lasted about a second before Shadow made contact with the interior of Amy's boot, not a soft impact either. Then another jolt sent Shadow flying downwards again, once again making contact with Amy's foot, this time only further down.

And again the process repeated, Shadow bouncing against the boot, and a lower part of the foot. And as unimaginable as it was things were getting worse. The further down he went, the more sweat seemed to populate Amy's feet; and with his gasps of pain Shadow occasionally swallowed it. The smell too....Shadow had never once experienced the smell of feet, but with modern media he had a natural impression of a bad smell. This was the worst possible way to introduce him to it. It was strong enough to water even his stoic pain-filled eyes. The source was fairly obvious given it got worse as he got lower, Amy's gigantic toes which were over twenty times Shadow's height. And still Shadow headed towards them Fate was kind though, Shadow stopped by landing on Amy's big toe nail; he child-like tantrum appeared to finally be over. Shadow was so happy he would have kissed Amy's toe nail if his lips hadn't already experienced more than enough feet for a life time.

Still, this was no time for rest. Amy's tantrum just further proved the point of the power she wielded over him, if she decided to start walking Shadow would find a new definition for the term hell. Still woozy Shadow punched the nail, not much but better than nothing; just the best he had at this moment. A couple seconds of rest and he would hit again, MUCH harder. But Shadow didn't have that chance.
142112.title: Sucks to be Shadow

choices: "Since you like my toe so much,I'll just put you back on it...."
"Let me get a closer look a you...."
1421121.content:
"What was that..?"

Even with her voice deafened from being inside her boot,Amy's voice still made Shadow cringe."It felt like a tiny tickle....."

That hurt Shadow's ego a tad.A hit from him only tickled Amy.Possibilities of bad outcomes gave him some shivers.If Amy noticed him,and she was to be violent towards him,he woul have little to zero chance of winning that fight.He couldn't run way,Amy would simply stomp her city-sized boot onto him.Fighing back...would only make her giggle from slight tickles.

Suddenly,a massive earthquake made him drop to the ground,or toe to be precise.Amy was bringing her foot out of her boot,making light pierce Shadow's eyes.Amy's face,miles above,gazed down questioningly."It felt like it was coming from my big toe...."She brought her face closer,squinting her eyes.Had she noticed Shadow?He pressed his body closer to the massive pink toe,hoping he was too small to be seen.She stared down at her toe for a few minutes,but it felt like a silence-gripped eternity for Shadow.

His fears soon became reality.Amy brought a gloved hand down,picking Shadow off her toe,trapping him between two walls of white known as fingers."Did this tiny speck tickle me?"She asked herself,bringing the 'speck' closer to her face.

"Is it a bug?It's soooo tiny....amazing at all it tickled me."Amy said,completely distracted now from her childish tantrum about Sonic.Shadow struggled to release himself from the entrapment,but Amy's fingers had him pinned and were slowly squeezing him.

"Aww...your actually kinda cute Mister Bug!"Amy giggled,a booming noise that nearly split Shadows ears.Tough luck that he couln't free his arms to cover them.Whether Amy realized it or nother squeezing was going to crush him.Shadow could already feel his eyes popping out,and finding it hard to breathe."I'm going to die....from being accidentally.....crushed between fingers?!"He gasped out.He would've cursed an shouted,but his situation prevented it.

"Okay Mister Bug...."Amy spoke.
1421121.title: Found!

choices: Just search all of Station Square!! (Shadow may not make it...)
Maybe Cream and Vanilla could help her out? To their place!
1421122.content:
Ever vocal about what to do Amy said aloud her intentions; “That does it! I’m gonna find that man and give him a piece of this girl’s mind!” Sounded like a mad lover normally; but to Shadow she might as well have signed his death waver. In the simplest of motions Amy rose off her couch and stood up; and yet it literally rocked Shadow’s world. The various contractions of every muscle in Amy’s body allowed her to move, and while usually unimportant; to Shadow it just made hell a little bit worse. The muscle holding Amy’s foot still reacted to the body rising, or in simpler terms, her foot moved to accommodate her body. If Shadow had something to hold on to the motion would have had no effect, but Amy’s toe nail was as smooth as can be; without anything to help him out Shadow was soon knocked into the smelly air once more.

He only flew an inch or so, but it felt like damn near a mile before Shadow smacked against the top of Amy’s boot. The disgruntled feeling of slamming against worn, sweaty leather was not something Shadow wanted to repeat; but he’d have to get used to it if Amy followed through what she meant. Another motion on Amy’s part caused Shadow to fall, and to his dismay it wasn’t the toe nail he landed back on. It was the insole of the boot, specifically between Amy’s toes. The absorbed sweat reduced the impact but it didn’t stop the breath from getting knocked out of him.

Another movement by Amy; maybe her foot going back down, whatever it was it seemed to tilt Shadow’s world to the side. To the hedgehog’s dismay he could feel his body sliding towards the rest of Amy’s toes, not if he had anything to say about it. Stubbornly Shadow clawed at the insole, gripping some loose leather and holding on for dear life. But it wasn’t helping, Shadow’s gloves and the sweat the insole held were not working well together, his grip was slipping. “Dammit all to hell!” Shadow cursed, swallowing his pride and biting Amy’s insole. If his hands wouldn’t be enough then he’d use his mouth! No matter what foul fluids slid down his throat, no matter how humiliating it was. And boy was it humiliating; Shadow was struggling for his life in the boot of a girl not even half his age, and she wasn’t even out of her home yet!

Shadow’s struggles soon proved futile, his will was certainly strong enough; but against Amy and her boot it simply wasn’t working. He was getting defeated by a boot of all things! His hands began to fail him, and soon lost their grip; he was now literally hanging by his teeth. It was not looking well for that either, Shadow did not count on foot sweat soaked leather to taste so…so bad. He had forced down some disgusting gunk before but Shadow had never experienced something like this! Even with all his will his teeth were starting to loosen their grip.

Not that it mattered; Shadow’s struggles were doomed from the beginning. Amy rose her foot again, and in the moment her foot readjusted itself. Maybe a centimeter to her, totally unimportant, but to Shadow…it was enough for her big toe to loom over him. In that one instant, in the darkness Shadow looked up at the pink toe of the hedgehog, and he lost his teeth’s grip in a rare moment of fear. He could see his fate beneath that foot. Literally dying like a bug, a red splatter against pink fur.

The next second came and Shadow had already wished his struggles moments before never ended, Amy’s toe held the weight of several cities, all of it focused on one, miniscule, black speck. Hundreds of miles away the loud sound of metallic clinking caught Shadow’s attention, seemed like keys. Shadow never saw Amy drive but he prayed that’s what the keys were for. A couple foot steps later Shadow felt his bones beginning to crack from the pressure, as well as his eyes beginning to sting from the sweat seeping into them. Would this really be his end? Beneath the toe of Amy Rose? Doomed never to even be found? It was depressing, and more importantly, beyond degrading. He could feel his pride dwindling, at this rate he started wishing he chose to live his life like a bug. Compared to this fate it seemed...pleasant.

All the while Shadow had his plight, Amy was humming a soft tune to herself, a tune that seemed to mock the speck at her toes. With her keys Amy opened her door, and sealed it on the other side. Turning to the bright world around her Amy let out a content sigh, "Ahh...what a nice day!...Little hot though. Ah well, I'll get used to it." That slight heat, unknown to Amy, was making her feet start to make fresh sweat...and Shadow did not like how it felt. Amy looked around her, a slight breeze, people going about their daily lives, it was nice to see. But she had to focus! There was a certain blue hedgehog who was gonna get a piece of her mind! But where to look?
1421122.title: Struggles for Survival

choices: He'd better start searching for his friends, there's a lot of house to cover.
Gotta find Amy and get her attention!
14213.content:
The black hedgehog briefly looked over his options; climb Amy's gigantic boot or climb her couch then her. Either way it was going to be extremely risky, possibly even more so than any of Shadow's previous battles. The slightest movement, a wiggle of the foot, a sneeze, even just shuffling around slightly could easily end up with Shadow getting crushed under what was possibly the weight of an entire city. Shadow grunted in annoyance as he let himself fall to the floor, eyes closed as he thought intently.

He overlooked the possible outcomes of each option, obviously the positive one was getting found and returning to normal, the negatives however were far worse than that. There was a chance Amy would sit on him, a chance Shadow would fall into her boot, a chance she would actually keep him as a pet of some sorts and maybe even torture him! In this bleak situation his two choices had pretty much one positive and roughly thirty negatives. Odds didn't bother Shadow at all though, if anything he worked best when he had little to no chance of success but he was no fool. Although size would beg to differ Amy was not a mountain, she was a living creature and like all living creatures she would move and do things. Shadow would probably take a couple hours at the least to climb her and in that time she would almost certainly go eat, move, go to the bathroom, something that would most likely kill Shadow should he be climbing at that moment.

Using this logic Shadow for once in his life chose not to act, despite how much he personally disliked it. There were too many risks, not to mention too many unanswered mysteries. How did he shrink and more importantly how did he end up in Amy Rose's house of all places? He was halfway around the globe before he fell asleep!

Shadow thought over what he was doing before he fell asleep, investigating a mysterious anomaly that was possibly linked to disappearances. Minorly uncertain Shadow took another look at the massive treads of Amy's boot, if the disappearances were linked to all this then how many people met their end underneath that rubber? How many people died with nothing but the image of the beautiful pink hedgehog going about her day as the last thing they saw? It was almost enough to make Shadow sick.

Still, he didn't have time to wallow in possibilities like that. He needed to think, think of how he had shrunken, how he could get someones attention, how he could do so safely. It was all frustrating. The mysterious anomaly....if it was connected to Eggman as Omega suggested it would help explain why Shadow was with Amy; the Doctor would probably look at it as lovely irony.

The idea made the hedgehog's fist shake in anger, "If he did this to me he is a dead man.." After a few moments Shadow took a deep breath and calmed down, getting fired up would not help him in the least. He racked his brain, thinking over so many possible things he could do; but none of them were safer or even as effective as Shadow's main two ideas. Again Shadow looked at Amy's unrealistically large boots, noticing all the dirt and grime he had never before seen on her shoe at his normal size. Almost transfixed, Shadow stared at the boot, thoughts slowing to a crawl.

"Focus!" He yelled to himself in minor frustration, trying to bring his mind back on topic. Again he racked his brain, still coming up with nothing. Shadow thought long and hard, and before he even realized it he was asleep.

The dream was clear, vivid, as were most of Shadow's nightmares; the pleasant ones were usually blurry. However this seemed more pleasant than a nightmare, it was almost like a slideshow; various memories of Shadow together with his friends Rouge and Omega. Doing their jobs, fighting, helping one another, the typical things Team Dark did. It was all nice, until it came to the final bit, not memories but horrific scenes of both Rouge and Omega dead. Rouge literally was a splat of blood with sprinkles of white fur, and Omega was wires stuck against a large rubber surface.

Like a jab from a knife it hit him, "Rouge! Omega!" the concern came out in a loud shout of dismay as Shadow awoke and leapt into the air. If he was shrunken then chances were his comrades were too, which also held a possibility that they too were somewhere inside Amy's home. Somewhere inside the unaware hedgehog's nausiating home.

Shadow didn't have to think for a moment about what needed to be done, his friends could be in trouble and that was all that mattered. Still he had no idea how much time had passed, Amy's boots no longer occupied most of Shadow's vision and he couldn't detect any traces of her nearby. It was still light out from beneath Amy's couch so it was at the least still daytime.

Mentally Shadow pictured the house's structure, thankfully it had only one floor so Shadow wouldn't have to worry about a struggle with stairs. Two bathrooms, a kitchen, a living room, a dining room, and two bedrooms; each a fair size. At Shadow's possibly millimeter height however each room would likely take at least a couple hours to investigate, each. And that is if only is they had solid flat floors, assuming that each room had the jungle of carpetting Shadow had to navigate through to get where he was he could very well spend eight hours per room.

The thought wasn't exactly a morale booster, already Shadow felt his mission was looking futile. He could easily spend the next week looking through Amy's home, but if he were to go with his original plan and get the giantess's attention then things could go far faster. Putting some thought into it Shadow......

Whatever. I'll find out the answers eventually." Suddenly, the ground shook with booming footsteps. (Shadow remembers Sonic and his friends (including Cosmo), the ARK, and Maria because he hit his head really hard and got all of his memories back.) Maria Robotnik walked into the room and almost stepped on Shadow with her blue shoes. "Is that Maria?! But how?! She was killed 50 years ago! Unless.. I must have somehow shrunk, was teleported to the ARK, and sent back in time 50 years. That explains why Maria is here. Maybe I can finally talk to her again before I go back to present day. I have so much to say to her, but how can I do that when I'm like a dot to her?"

Shadow ran to Maria's foot and started climbing up, eventually reaching her face due to his extreme speed. Shadow took a rest on Maria's building sized lips. What happened to Shadow?

The Giantess Awakes while he's mid-dash....

1423.content:
All around him, the blades of grass towered above for miles. Even the small plant fibers were now visible, and scarily, as thick as oak trees. Shadow shook his head, trying to regain his composure. He was always the calm and collected one, he may have come off as silent and unemotional at times, but it allowed him to keep a cool head in any situation."Let's just regather everything..."He spoke to himself, pacing back and forth, trying to ignore the specks of dirt as large as mountains around him."I'm.....small. Very small. But I'm in the same area...so Rouge and Omega must be nearby. And..."A conclusion was made."The anomaly. The energy...it shrank me. That explains the dissapearances!!"He continued his self speech.

"But...where are the others?"He suddenly shuddered. What if they had unwittingly been trampled underneath Team Dark's feet?! He tried not to think of a dozen, maybe even a hundred microscopic people dissapearing into bloody smears beneath his sneakers or Rouge's boots or Omega's metallic stompers.

He shook his head once more."No need to think of the negative...have to find a solution to this."

Off in the distance, Rouge's tent loomed high in the sky. Since she was the closest, Shadow made the sound judgement to try and contact her first.

Super speed was extremely helpful in the travel. At normal height, he'd be going at the speed of sound. At his puny size, about twice the speed of a toddler trying to walk. Though if he kept this up, he's be at the tent in another ten minutes or so.

............

And so Shadow arrived at the tent, it's entrance a massive white wall. Though, entering it was no problem for the shrunken hedgehog. All he had to do was climb in through the fibers of the tent. Once he made his way through the network, he was inside the the tent, his eyes naturally adjusting to the confines of darkness. Off in the distance, a sleeping Rouge rested on a fine silk bed, the She-Bat's soft breathing sounding like a wind storm twisting it's way towards him."And....I have this to get to."Shadow sighed at another high-speed dash towards his goal.
1423.title: One Big Thief

choices: Silver falls into the river going through the cave
One of Dr.Robotnick's robots enters the cave and abducts Amy (rescue mission)
143.content:
Silver the Hedgehog panted slightly as he finally caught up with the young hedgehog known as Amy Rose. She had been running about the areas around Soleanna, the City of Water, for hours now. She was just slowing down in the nearby jungle, just south of the city. He couldn't have been more relieved. It was clear that he had no idea on how to deal with energetic females. Blaze was nothing like the spunky pink hedgehog that had literally dragged him around searching for this "Sonic" character. How did Silver get himself into this anyway? The mission was supposed to be simple: travel to the past, then find and destroy the Iblis Trigger. He hadn't been expecting the task to be easy, but he hadn't expected to become distracted by something as small as a love-struck female either. Silver had to stop himself from laughing at this scenario. Amy finally stopped her search momentarily when she ran into a cliff, It went up about thirty feet, and Amy didn't really want to try and jump that. She turned to her companion behind her and saw he that he was gasping for air.

"Are you all right, Silver?" Amy asked, Silver caught his breath and gave her a small nod. She made note of his exhaustion.

"Why don't we take a break for the night? It's getting late."

Silver just gave another nod, glancing around the surrounding trees. To his left he spotted a cave entrance in the cliff, next to a small river. Amy followed his gaze, and with a smile sprinted towards it.The cave entrance was a small tunnel, and Amy couldn't tell how far into the cliff it went, the two hedgehogs entered the cave to get some rest. The cave led to a small niche that made a circle about twelve feet in diameter and six feet to the top, leaving plenty of room for the hedgehogs to sleep for the night. Amy set up two "beds" from leaves she had collected from outside, then went on to build a small fire. Silver jumped just a little when she finally got the flame going, his survival instincts against Iblis coming out, but he calmed quickly at the sight of Amy relaxing by the fire.

"So, Silver..." Amy scanned her brain trying to think of something to make conversation with. "Who are you looking for anyway?"

Silver was quiet. He sat himself across the fire from the female and debated with himself about exactly how much he should tell her.

"I'm searching for the Iblis Trigger," he said. At her puzzled face he continued. "In the near future, the Iblis Trigger will destroy...where I'm from. I've been sent to stop him."

He felt he had to choose his words carefully. Amy just thought he was from some other location in this time period. It might complicate things if he tried to explain that he was also from the future. Silver wasn't sure if time travel was possible in this era, and if it wasn't then she might think he was crazy for suggesting otherwise.

"Sort of like a prophesy then?" Amy asked. Silver nodded. He guessed that was one way to put it.

"Pretty brave of you, going off on your own to save your home."

"I wasn't alone," Silver explained, though he felt slightly elated at her words.

"I got separated from Blaze. I'm looking for her too, I suppose."

"Well, don't worry." Amy gave him a wide smile, though this concealed a flash of jealousy. Who was Blaze? The name sounded familiar, but she couldn't place it.

"Like I said, you help me find Sonic, and I'll help you find the Iblis Trigger and this Blaze of yours." While Silver was in high spirits at Amy?s offer to help him his happiness faded, as he also felt rather annoyed that whoever Sonic was took up so much of her attention. He couldn't exactly place the reason for his annoyance though.

"I think it's time for bed," Amy said with a yawn. In truth, she wanted to get away from the subject of his female friend. She laid herself down on one of the leaf beds, across the cave from Silver's. "Don't worry about the fire. It'll burn itself out. Good night, Silver."

"...Night, Amy." Silver replied quietly. He placed himself on his own bed, facing Amy. Unfortunately that direction also faced the campfire. "Don't worry about the fire...it'll burn itself out." he repeated.

Silver still instinctively felt tense because of the fire, but those thoughts didn't last long once he caught sight of Amy's serene sleeping face. He kept an eye on that until he fell asleep himself.

Fire...smoke...rubble...heat...a roar and a scream from Blaze...!

Silver sprung awake, shocking himself out of the nightmare about Iblis. Could he not escape that monster even in his dreams?! He let out a groan and slammed his palm to his forehead.

Wait a minute...why was everything so big? He looked to Amy and yelped, she'd tuned into a giantess!

No...that wasn't right... Silver reasoned after he'd calmed himself. If everything was bigger...than that ment...

Ho-no...

"I've SHRUNK!" Silver exclaimed at the top of his voice, his shout sounded like a chipmonk on helium.
143.title: Silver

choices: On a beach where a very attractive bat seemed to be getting a tan (Rouge)
In some woods where a very beautiful human was looking sad (Elise)
Silver washed up near a city...where Blaze is!!
1432.content:
Silver gritted his teeth and pondered over what could've happened, how did he shrink? Was it Amy...no she was too nice. Maybe one of the many machines he had seen around? It was even possible that this was correlated to the Iblis Trigger, with the way Iblis devastated his world it definitely seemed possible. He looked at Amy and felt his rage calm, she was...beautiful while giant and asleep, but Silver was on a mission and he was going to see it through!

His first plan of action was obvious, get Amy's attention; right now Silver couldn't best one of the lousy robots he's seen around let alone the Iblis Trigger. But...there was a complication, this cave while an ideal resting spot had a small little river flowing down the middle, soothing and nothing to the normal sized but to Silver....it was chasm that went on for at least a couple miles, filled to the brim with roaring water. Even with telekinesis getting across was going to be difficult. But this was nothing compared to his mission, if anything it was a test to see his determination so Silver was determined to go for the challenge!

He started by lifting a few boulder sized pebbles via telekinesis and throwing them into the water....didn't help much since the water flew them away with ease. It meant making a bridge was out, so Silver had one other option...he would have to glide all the way across the river. He didn't just rush into it though, Silver played it smart. With his telekinesis he lifted multiple pebbles again, but instead of throwing them into the river he stacked them on top of one another, until he had a wobbly tower that seemed to be at least twenty feet tall. With ease Silver climbed to the top and looked over the landscape, if he messed this up that water was going to wash him away to god knows where, but if he succeeded he could get Amy to help him. He took a deep breath, visualized Blaze encouraging him, focused on reaching Amy and finally...Silver leapt into the air.

His hair-like spikes flew along with the air as he seemed to plummett towards the water but Silver used a short burst of telekinesis to sort of glide over a little bit, then he allowed gravity to take over, and then he used a short burst again. It seemed unneccessarily complicated but Silver was doing this for maximum range, years of fighting Iblis taught him much regarding how his powers could best be used. More than once Silver eyed the cave with a slight horror, if he messed up...the river would send him anywhere maybe even kill him, he might get killed by one of the sharper rocks, or god forbid he lands somewhere where Amy would unconciously crush him! It dazed him slightly but the hedgehog stayed focused and kept with his plan, but his mind was getting weak...he didn't have much strength left. He was almost there...just a couple inches to go...and...he did it! He was now safely gliding over land! All Silver had left to do was let gravity take over and use telekinesis one last time to ensure he landed safely!

Or at least...that's how Silver wished things played out, but fate was cruel. For some reason a sudden burst of wind tore through the cave, and being as small as a fly Silver was sent flying back towards the water, over halfway back through his journey. And to top it off, his strength finally gave out and he fell into the chilly water with a splash.

He swam up and gasped for air, the current knocked any physical strength out of his body. His mind was tired, his body too weak to do anything, still Silver attempted to swim far enough for shore, but the tide was against him...literally and when his back was turned to the water fate struck again; a pebble dislodged due to the current and smacked directly into Silver, in his weakened state he passed out almost instantly and sank into the water where the current dragged him away.

Even unconcious Silver got no rest, he honestly preferred his fate in the river than what his dreams held...Iblis, images of the various incarnations of the beast destroying his city, his friends, everything Silver loved Iblis attacked. Then the dream switched to Mephiles, who looked at him and reexplained the story regarding Iblis, a reminder to Silver and his mission...it filled him with vigor and courage...

"Iblis!!!!!" He roared as his body stood up.

Somehow Silver lived...and he washed somewhere, he was less than ten feet away from a water source, but tides carried him to land, he had to look to see where he was.....
1432.title: So Close!

choices: Rouge closes her hand around him and decides to keep Silver as her pet
Rouge thinks Silver is some kind of bug and tries squshing him
14321.content:
The tide granted Silver some sympathy and washed him up onto a beach. The telepathic hedgehog wasted no time in scrambling to refuge under a beach lounge chair. Free of the threat of getting washed away, Silver took a moment to admire the ocean mirroring the blue sky, the white froth as it broke and receded agains the white sand from the movements of the tide, how the sunlight reflecting off the water's surface causing the surface to shimmer beautifully. The sight only furthered 's resolve. He HAD to end Iblis before it began. However, he had more immediate concerns, where was he?

His thoughts were cut short as a shadow covered his hiding place. Silver looked up and saw who had decided to relax on the lounge chair he was under and saw it was a very attractive bat. She wore thigh-length white boots that had small hearts at the toe area, a black leather bodysuit with a pink heart at the chest to make room for her cleavage, and nearly elbow-length white gloves. She stretched out and enjoyed the warmth of the sun.

Silver knew this was his chance and rushed to her boots and leapt for one, using his powers to give himself an extra boost and was able to grab onto the edge of her boot's heel before pulling himself up, he wasn't particularly fast like he'd heard this pain-in-the-butt Sonic character he'd heard about from Amy was, but survival with Iblis running amoke ment Silver's physical ability level was excellent. He then began to climb the boot's sole, using his telekinesis whenever he could. After hours, he made it to the toe of the boot and simply slid down it. After that, he ran up her leg, however, Silver had failed to realise one thing: the way his body glowed witha neon blue-green outline hadn't escaped the notice of the she-bat. Silver felt the "ground" under him shift and he looked up to see a giant hand heading straight for him. Silver turned and bolted but it was no use, he jumped off the she-bat only for the massive hand to reach out and close around him. The world shifted as she moved and then Silver founde himself blinded as the hand he was in opened and light poured into his field of vision.

As he rubbed his eyes to clear the blurs away, he heard someone speak.

"Nice try, whatever you are, but nothing escapes the notice of Rouge the bat."

As Silver's sight returned, he fell backwards with a yelp as there was a near plant-sized eye inches from him. Rouge, if he'd heard right, looked him over, examining him.

When she had deducted whatever the tiny creature she'd captured was indeed alive, Rouge...
14321.title: captured by a she-bat

choices: You can spread my sun tan lotion while we're out."
I got nothing, just stick around in my boot until I think of something."
143211.content:
With a playful snicker Rouge closed her hand around Silver, her massive fingers squishing the puny hedgehog into the soft skin of her palm. "I'd recognize those spikes anywhere, you're another hedgehog like Shadow. What's your name?"

Silver had to scream his answer out for it to be heard by Rouge's amazing ears, "Silver! Silver the Hedgehog!"

Rouge unfolded her hand and eyed Silver with more interest, "I can see why your name is Silver..." She pointed to his silvery fur. "What's up with the size? Is that how it works for hedgehogs, some are fast others are smaller than dirt?"

Silver's temper got the better of him for a moment, "No you stupid bat! I use telekinesis! I have no idea why I'm small!!"

For a brief moment Rouge's eyes flickered with annoyance but she quickly replaced it with a playful allure and leaned forward so her lipstick covered lips were just inches away from swallowing Silver up in their grasp. "Be careful what you say little Silver; it looks like you are only about a centimeter tall. At that size you couldn't even beat up my pinky, let alone yell at me like you're stronger than me. Now, what do you have to say?"

Each word Rouge let out made her breath caress Silver in an oddly pleasurable way, it smelled of fresh berries mixed with a hint of mint...an odd combination but it was nice. It made Silver's spikes blow with each syllable, like a heavy wind was blowing around him. He knew what Rouge wanted, and he knew she was probably his only source of help at the moment so Silver bit his lip and apologized, "Sorry...I'm just frustrated at being little."

Rouge shrugged, "No problem hun, if I had to guess I'd say Eggman did this to ya. Seems like the kind of thing he would come up with. Although why you and not Sonic or Shadow I have no idea."

Again with Sonic...Silver really had to meet this guy. But more importantly Rouge explained someone who could've done this...and if he did it...he could undo it. Silver could get fixed and go back to his mission! "Hey..uh Rouge right? Can you take me to this Eggman guy?"

The giant bat shook her head and leaned back against her sun chair oddly relaxed, "Not a good idea, me and Eggman...aren't exactly buddies if you catch my drift. Me, I'm more of a jewel kinda girl. If there's jewels in it I'll team up with someone. Only exceptions are with Shadow and Omega and that's cause they're my buddies."

Silver paled a little bit, "Can one of them help me?"

Rouge laughed like it was a huge joke, "Probably not. Shadow isn't exactly friendly and Omega's even worse about it. Although there isn't anything to help, nothing at all." This last sentence seemed to carry a hidden depth in it but Silver didn't catch it...at least not then.

"Nothing to help!? Look at me! You said so yourself, I'm a flipping centimeter tall!" As if in demonstration Silver angrily kicked at Rouge's palm, not that she felt it.

Rouge didn't break he cool demeanor, "Exactly, perfect size for a pet."

"PET?!!?!?!"

Silver's reaction made Rouge chuckle, "Of course sweety, came to mind right when I saw ya. I always wanted a pet, oh the heists we could do, the activities...man. It's more like partners than anything." Rouge's eyes seemed to gleam with menace for a moment, "But partner can mean slave real quick you got it?"

The sudden moodswing made Silver gulp, "Y-yes mam."

"Good!" Rouge sounded normal again, leaning back into her chair.

Silver never saw such an activity in his future so it seemed odd, "What are you doing Rouge?"

"Tanning of course, a girl has to keep her looks up."

Silver eyed Rouge's outfit skeptically, "You're...fully dressed."

Rouge's eyes flew open like this was a sacred truth, "Oh my god you're right! God I must seem like such a ditz right now!" Before anything else could be said Rouch hid...no more like flung Silver into her cleavage. "Stay there while I undress!" Silver.... couldn't reply he was blushing too hard.

In the Future Silver never had any time for romance or anything like that so the feeling of a breast...it was new; and Rouge's massive mammeries at his size seemed absolutely ungodly. It was hot inside her cleavage...but something made Silver not care. 153322.content:
Goombella sat at a desk in the Rogueport Inn, staring at her ever-present textbook. In the three days since Mario and Peach had returned from the Mushroom Kingdom, she had been feverishly searching for any information that might lead them to the new treasure that Peach had heard about. Since then, the book had been unhelpful in revealing information, but at last, she came across a passage that described something new. She hopped excitedly off her chair and rushed out the door, turning toward Prof. Frankly's house. She knocked on the door and waited for the professor's answer.
"...Hurry it up, Professor..." she muttered after a few seconds had passed. Finally, the door began to open, and before it had even fully opened, she pushed inside. Mario and Peach were sitting at the table, and turned to greet her. Peach had just opened her mouth to speak when Goombella interrupted her.
"I know, I'm here. That's not important right now. Take a look at this!" she exclaimed, slamming the textbook onto the table. Peach and Mario leaned over it to read. After several moments, Peach spoke up.
"So, this hidden tunnel is just next to the site of the Thousand-Year Door?"
"Yep!" Goombella answered. "There's a seal holding it closed that nobody's ever been able to open before, but I'd bet we can do it!" Peach smiled and stood up.
"Well, there's no sense wasting time here, then. Let's get going." She walked over to and out the door, followed by Mario, Goombella, and Frankly.

Several minutes later, the group arrived at the huge room that contained the Thousand-Year Door.
"It should be somewhere around here..." Goombella said, moving along the wall.
"Really, now. How are you going to know if you've found it?" Frankly asked. Goombella ignored him and continued to press along the wall.
"There's a huge crack in the wall here, but it buts off around....here! Aha!" she stopped and stepped back from the wall. "When we opened the Door, the cracks must have broken the seal!"
"That's perfect!" Peach said, joining Goombella next to the cracked area.
"Mario, give us a hand with this!" Goombella called. Mario rushed over, Hammer in hand. Leaning back, he took a massive swing a the wall.

With a resounding CRACK,/i} the wall caved in. Goombella began to hop on the spot.
"Yes! I knew we could find it!" she yelled happily. The group walked into the newly-created doorway, and looked around. They were in a short tunnel that let off into a small atrium. In the centre of the room, there was a large chest.
"Fascinating!" Frankly said, rushing over to inspect it.
"That was easier to find than I expected." Peach said, smiling.
"Well, Mario? Let's get this thing open!" Goombella yelled, dragging Mario toward the chest.
"Stand-a back." Mario said to Frankly and Peach, grabbing the edge of the lid. He pulled on the lid and with a loud creak, the chest opened.

For a moment, nothing happened. Mario leaned over to inspect the inside, and Goombella hopped onto the rim to do the same. Suddenly, a blinding flash filled the room, and a powerful force pushed everyone in the room over, unconscious.
